BitField.description: Master 3 Priviledge, Buffer, Read, Write Control.
BitField.name: MPROT3

Enum.description: Accesses from this master are forced to user-mode (ips_supervisor_access is forced to zero) regardless of the hprot[1] access attribute.
Enum.name: MPL0

Enum.description: Accesses from this master are not forced to user-mode. The hprot[1] access attribute is used directly to determine ips_supervisor_access.
Enum.name: MPL1

BitField.description: Master 3 Priviledge, Buffer, Read, Write Control.
BitField.name: MPROT3

Enum.description: Zero cross detetion function powered up
Enum.name: powered_up

Enum.description: Zero cross detetion function powered down
Enum.name: powered_down

Enum.description: If DISABLE_AUTO_CLK_SWITCH is set to 0 and 24M xtal is OK, the clock source will switch from internal ring OSC to 24M xtal automatically
Enum.name: xtal_clk

Enum.description: If DISABLE_AUTO_CLK_SWITCH is set to 1, SEL_CLK will determine which clock source the DCDC uses
Enum.name: sel_clk

BitField.description: Power down signal of the current detector.
BitField.name: PWD_CUR_SNS_CMP

Enum.description: In Run Mode, 1 A. In Power Save Mode, 0.25 A
Enum.name: select_zero

Enum.description: In Run Mode, 2 A. In Power Save Mode, 0.25 A
Enum.name: select_one

Enum.description: In Run Mode, 1 A. In Power Save Mode, 0.2 A
Enum.name: select_two

Enum.description: In Run Mode, 2 A. In Power Save Mode, 0.2 A
Enum.name: select_three

Enum.description: Low voltage detection comparator is enabled
Enum.name: enabled

Enum.description: Low voltage detection comparator is disabled
Enum.name: disabled

Enum.description: Overload Detection in power save mode disabled
Enum.name: disabled

Enum.description: Overload Detection in power save mode enabled
Enum.name: enabled

Enum.description: Adjust hysteretic value in low power to 12.5mV
Enum.name: lp_12p5mV

Enum.description: Adjust hysteretic value in low power to 25mV
Enum.name: lp_25mV

Enum.description: Disable xtalok detection circuit and always outputs OK signal "1"
Enum.name: disabled

BitField.description: Select the feedback point of the internal regulator
BitField.name: REG_FBK_SEL

Enum.description: The regulator outputs 1.0V with 1.2V reference voltage
Enum.name: reg_fbk_sel0

Enum.description: The regulator outputs 1.1V with 1.2V reference voltage
Enum.name: reg_fbk_sel1

Enum.description: The regulator outputs 1.0V with 1.3V reference voltage
Enum.name: reg_fbk_sel2

Enum.description: The regulator outputs 1.1V with 1.3V reference voltage
Enum.name: reg_fbk_sel3

BitField.description: This controls the load resistor of the internal regulator of DCDC
BitField.name: REG_RLOAD_SW

Enum.description: Lower hysteresis threshold (about 2.5mV in typical, but this value can vary with PVT corners
Enum.name: low_hyst_thresh

Enum.description: Disable hysteresis in switching converter common mode analog comparators
Enum.name: disable

Enum.description: Enable hysteresis in switching converter common mode analog comparators
Enum.name: enable

BitField.description: Two's complement feed forward step in duty cycle in the switching DC-DC converter
BitField.name: LOOPCTRL_DC_FF

BitField.description: Increase the threshold detection for RC scale circuit.
BitField.name: LOOPCTRL_RCSCALE_THRSH

Enum.description: Do not increase the threshold detection for RC scale circuit.
Enum.name: no_increase_thrsh

Enum.description: Increase the threshold detection for RC scale circuit.
Enum.name: increase_thrsh

BitField.description: Invert the sign of the hysteresis in DC-DC analog comparators.
BitField.name: LOOPCTRL_HYST_SIGN

Enum.description: Do not invert sign of the hysteresis
Enum.name: noinvert

Enum.description: DCDC will be idle to save current dissipation when the duty cycle get to the low limit which is set by NEGLIMIT_IN.
Enum.name: idle

Enum.description: DCDC will keep working with the low limited duty cycle NEGLIMIT_IN.
Enum.name: not_idle

BitField.description: Set DCDC clock to half frequency for continuous mode
BitField.name: MINPWR_DC_HALFCLK

Enum.description: DCDC clock remains at full frequency for continuous mode
Enum.name: fullfreq

Enum.description: DCDC clock set to half frequency for continuous mode
Enum.name: halffreq

Enum.description: Enable stepping for the output of VDD_SOC of DCDC
Enum.name: enable

Enum.description: Disable stepping for the output of VDD_SOC of DCDC
Enum.name: disable

Enum.description: Timers continue to run in Debug mode.
Enum.name: t000001

Enum.description: Timers are stopped in Debug mode.
Enum.name: t0000011

Enum.description: Clock for standard PIT timers is enabled.
Enum.name: t0301

Enum.description: Clock for standard PIT timers is disabled.
Enum.name: t00000111

Enum.description: Interrupt requests from Timer n are disabled.
Enum.name: t0331

Enum.description: Interrupt is requested whenever TIF is set.
Enum.name: t077711

Enum.description: Timer is chained to a previous timer. For example, for channel 2, if this field is set, Timer 2 is chained to Timer 1.
Enum.name: timer0081

Enum.description: Interrupt requests from Timer n are disabled.
Enum.name: t0331

Enum.description: Interrupt is requested whenever TIF is set.
Enum.name: t077711

Enum.description: Timer is chained to a previous timer. For example, for channel 2, if this field is set, Timer 2 is chained to Timer 1.

Enum.description: Interrupt is requested whenever TIF is set.

Enum.name: timer0081

Enum.description: SNVS domain will reset when system reset happens
Enum.name: LPSR_MODE_ENABLE_0

Enum.description: SNVS domain will only reset with SNVS POR
Enum.name: LPSR_MODE_ENABLE_1

Enum.description: 100 Ohm pull up enabled for POR_B always
Enum.name: POR_PULL_TYPE_0

Enum.description: Disable pull in SNVS mode, 100 Ohm pull up enabled otherwise
Enum.name: POR_PULL_TYPE_1

Enum.description: 100 Ohm pull down enabled in SNVS mode, 100 Ohm pull up enabled otherwise
Enum.name: POR_PULL_TYPE_3

Enum.description: DCDC is ramping up and not ready
Enum.name: DCDC_STS_DC_OK_0

Enum.description: Select mux mode: ALT0 mux port: SNVS_LP_PMIC_ON_REQ of instance: snvs_lp
Enum.name: ALT0

Enum.description: Select mux mode: ALT5 mux port: GPIO5_IO01 of instance: gpio5
Enum.name: ALT5

Enum.description: Input Path is determined by functionality
Enum.name: DISABLED

Enum.description: Force input path of pad PMIC_ON_REQ
Enum.name: ENABLED

Enum.description: Global interrupt request is not asserted
Enum.name: GINT_0

BitField.description: Exclusive monitor response select of illegal command
BitField.name: EXC_MON

BitField.description: Arm CM7 platform AHB clock enable
BitField.name: CM7_FORCE_HCLK_EN

Enum.description: AHB clock is not running (gated) when CM7 is sleeping and TCM is not accessible
Enum.name: CM7_FORCE_HCLK_EN_0

Enum.description: AHB clock is running (enabled) when CM7 is sleeping and TCM is accessible
Enum.name: CM7_FORCE_HCLK_EN_1

BitField.description: Enable power saving features on L2 memory
BitField.name: L2_MEM_EN_POWERSAVING

Enum.description: Enters power saving mode only when chip is in SUSPEND mode
Enum.name: L2_MEM_EN_POWERSAVING_0

BitField.description: Automatically gate off RAM clock when RAM is not accessed.
BitField.name: RAM_AUTO_CLK_GATING_EN

Enum.description: disable automatically gate off RAM clock
Enum.name: RAM_AUTO_CLK_GATING_EN_0

Enum.description: enable automatically gate off RAM clock
Enum.name: RAM_AUTO_CLK_GATING_EN_1

BitField.description: This bit controls how memory (OCRAM) enters Deep Sleep mode (shutdown periphery power, but maintain memory contents, outputs of memory are pulled low
BitField.name: L2_MEM_DEEPSLEEP

Enum.description: No force sleep control supported, memory deep sleep mode only entered when whole system in stop mode (OCRAM in normal mode)
Enum.name: L2_MEM_DEEPSLEEP_0

Enum.description: Force memory into deep sleep mode (OCRAM in power saving mode)
Enum.name: L2_MEM_DEEPSLEEP_1

BitField.description: Divider ratio control for mclk from hmclk. mclk frequency = 1/(n+1) * hmclk frequency.
BitField.name: MQS_CLK_DIV

BitField.description: Select 128-bit DCP key from 256-bit key from SNVS Master Key
BitField.name: DCP_KEY_SEL

Enum.description: Select [127:0] from SNVS Master Key as DCP key
Enum.name: DCP_KEY_SEL_0

Enum.description: Select [255:128] from SNVS Master Key as DCP key
Enum.name: DCP_KEY_SEL_1

Enum.description: EDMA stop acknowledge is not asserted
Enum.name: EDMA_STOP_ACK_0

Enum.description: EDMA stop acknowledge is asserted (EDMA is in STOP mode)
Enum.name: EDMA_STOP_ACK_1

Enum.description: TRNG stop acknowledge is not asserted
Enum.name: TRNG_STOP_ACK_0

Enum.description: SAI1 stop acknowledge is not asserted
Enum.name: SAI1_STOP_ACK_0

Enum.description: SAI2 stop acknowledge is not asserted
Enum.name: SAI2_STOP_ACK_0

Enum.description: SAI3 stop acknowledge is not asserted
Enum.name: SAI3_STOP_ACK_0

Enum.description: PIT stop acknowledge is not asserted
Enum.name: PIT_STOP_ACK_0

Enum.description: FLEXSPI stop acknowledge is not asserted
Enum.name: FLEXSPI_STOP_ACK_0

Enum.description: FLEXIO1 stop acknowledge is not asserted
Enum.name: FLEXIO1_STOP_ACK_0

BitField.description: GPT2 input capture channel 1 source select
BitField.name: GPT2_CAPIN1_SEL

Enum.description: source from ENET_1588_EVENT3_OUT (chnnal 3 of IEEE 1588 timer)
Enum.name: GPT2_CAPIN1_SEL_1

BitField.description: Zeroizable Master Key Write Soft Lock When set, prevents any writes (software and hardware) to the ZMK registers and the ZMK_HWP, ZMK_VAL, and ZMK_ECC_EN fields of the LPMKCR

BitField.description: Secure Real Time Counter Soft Lock When set, prevents any writes to the SRTC Registers, SRTC_ENV, and SRTC_INV_EN bits
BitField.name: SRTC_SL

BitField.description: LP Calibration Soft Lock When set, prevents any writes to the LP Calibration Value (LPCALB_VAL) and LP Calibration Enable (LPCALB_EN)

BitField.description: Monotonic Counter Soft Lock When set, prevents any writes (increments) to the MC Registers and MC_ENV bit

BitField.description: LP Security Events Configuration Register Soft Lock When set, prevents any writes to the LPSECR

BitField.description: Master Key Select Soft Lock When set, prevents any writes to the MASTER_KEY_SEL field of the LPMKCR
BitField.name: MKS_SL

BitField.description: HP Security Violation Control Register Lock When set, prevents any writes to the HPSVCR

BitField.description: HP Security Interrupt Control Register Lock When set, prevents any writes to the HPSICR

BitField.description: High Assurance Counter Lock When set, prevents any writes to HPHACIVR, HPHACR, and HAC_EN bit of HPCOMR

Enum.name: ENABLED

BitField.description: LP Software Reset When set to 1, most registers in the SNVS_LP section are reset, but the following registers are not reset by an LP software reset: Monotonic Counter Secure Real Time Counter Time Alarm Register This bit cannot be set when the LP_SWR_DIS bit is set
BitField.name: LP_SWR

BitField.description: LP Software Reset Disable When set, disables the LP software reset
BitField.name: LP_SWR_DIS

BitField.description: LP Software Security Violation When set, SNVS_LP treats this bit as a security violation

BitField.description: Software Fatal Security Violation This bit is a read-only copy of the SW_FSV bit in the HP Command Register
BitField.name: SW_FSV

BitField.name: SW_LPSV

BitField.name: ZMK_SYNDROME

BitField.name: ZMK_ECC_FAIL

Enum.name: NOREPORT

BitField.name: LP_SEC_VIO

BitField.name: HAC_COUNTER_IV

BitField.name: HAC_COUNTER

Register.description: SNVS_HP Real Time Counter MSB Register
Register.name: HPRTCMR

BitField.description: HP Real Time Counter The most-significant 15 bits of the RTC

Register.description: SNVS_HP Real Time Counter LSB Register
Register.name: HPRTCLR

BitField.description: HP Real Time Counter least-significant 32 bits
BitField.name: RTC

BitField.description: Zeroizable Master Key Write Hard Lock When set, prevents any writes (software and hardware) to the ZMK registers and ZMK_HWP, ZMK_VAL, and ZMK_ECC_EN fields of the LPMKCR
BitField.name: ZMK_WHL

BitField.description: Zeroizable Master Key Read Hard Lock When set, prevents any software reads to the ZMK registers and ZMK_ECC_VALUE field of the LPMKCR
BitField.name: ZMK_RHL

Enum.description: Read access is allowed (only in software programming mode).
Enum.name: READ_ACCESS_ALLOWED

BitField.description: Secure Real Time Counter Hard Lock When set, prevents any writes to the SRTC registers, SRTC_ENV, and SRTC_INV_EN bits
BitField.name: SRTC_HL

BitField.description: LP Calibration Hard Lock When set, prevents any writes to the LP Calibration Value (LPCALB_VAL) and LP Calibration Enable (LPCALB_EN)
BitField.name: LPCALB_HL

BitField.description: Monotonic Counter Hard Lock When set, prevents any writes (increments) to the MC Registers and MC_ENV bit
BitField.name: MC_HL

BitField.description: General Purpose Register Hard Lock When set, prevents any writes to the GPR
BitField.name: GPR_HL

BitField.description: LP Security Violation Control Register Hard Lock When set, prevents any writes to the LPSVCR
BitField.name: LPSVCR_HL

BitField.description: LP Security Events Configuration Register Hard Lock When set, prevents any writes to the LPSECR
BitField.name: LPSECR_HL

BitField.description: Master Key Select Hard Lock When set, prevents any writes to the MASTER_KEY_SEL field of the LP Master Key Control Register
BitField.name: MKS_HL

BitField.description: Secure Real Time Counter Enabled and Valid When set, the SRTC becomes operational
BitField.name: SRTC_ENV

BitField.description: LP Time Alarm Enable When set, the SNVS functional interrupt is asserted if the LP Time Alarm Register is equal to the 32 MSBs of the secure real time counter
BitField.name: LPTA_EN

Enum.description: LP time alarm interrupt is disabled.
Enum.name: DISABLED

Enum.description: LP time alarm interrupt is enabled.
Enum.name: ENABLED

BitField.description: Monotonic Counter Enabled and Valid When set, the MC can be incremented (by write transaction to the LPSMCMR or LPSMCLR)
BitField.name: MC_ENV

BitField.description: LP Wake-Up Interrupt Enable This interrupt line should be connected to the external pin and is intended to inform the external chip about an SNVS_LP event (MC rollover, SRTC rollover, or time alarm )
BitField.name: LPWUI_EN

BitField.name: SRTC_INV_EN

Enum.description: SRTC is invalidated in the case of security violation.
Enum.name: INVALIDATE

BitField.name: LPCALB_EN

Enum.description: Security Violation 5 is disabled in the LP domain.
Enum.name: DISABLED

Enum.description: Security Violation 5 is enabled in the LP domain.
Enum.name: ENABLED

BitField.description: SRTC Rollover Enable When set, an SRTC rollover event generates an LP security violation.
BitField.name: SRTCR_EN

BitField.description: MC Rollover Enable When set, an MC Rollover event generates an LP security violation.
BitField.name: MCR_EN

BitField.description: System Power Fail Detector (PFD) Observability Flop The asynchronous reset input of this flop is connected directly to the inverted output of the PFD analog circuitry (external to the SNVS block)
BitField.name: PFD_OBSERV

BitField.description: Power On Reset (POR) Observability Flop The asynchronous reset input of this flop is connected directly to the output of the POR analog circuitry (external to the SNVS
BitField.name: POR_OBSERV

BitField.description: Low Temp Detect Configuration These configuration bits are wired as an output of the module.
BitField.name: LTDC

BitField.description: High Temperature Detect Configuration These configuration bits are wired as an output of the module
BitField.name: HTDC

BitField.description: Voltage Reference Configuration These configuration bits are wired as an output of the module.
BitField.name: VRC

BitField.description: Oscillator Bypass When OSCB=1 the osc_bypass signal is asserted
BitField.name: OSCB

Enum.description: Normal SRTC clock oscillator not bypassed.
Enum.name: NOT_BYPASSED

Enum.description: Normal SRTC clock oscillator bypassed. Alternate clock can drive the SRTC clock source.
Enum.name: BYPASSED

Enum.description: SRTC has not reached its maximum value.
Enum.name: NOREPORT

Enum.description: SRTC has reached its maximum value.
Enum.name: REPORTED

Enum.description: MC has not reached its maximum value.
Enum.name: NOREPORT

Enum.description: MC has reached its maximum value.
Enum.name: REPORTED

BitField.description: External Security Violation Detected Indicates that a security violation is detected on one of the HP security violation ports
BitField.name: ESVD

BitField.description: Emergency Off This bit is set when a power off is requested.
BitField.name: EO

BitField.description: Set Power Off The SPO bit is set when the power button is pressed longer than the configured debounce time
BitField.name: SPOF

Enum.description: Set Power Off was not detected.
Enum.name: NOREPORT

BitField.description: Set Power On The SPON bit is set when the set_pwr_on_irq interrupt is triggered, which happens when the power button is pressed longer than the configured debounce time
BitField.name: SPON

Enum.description: Set Power On Interrupt was not detected.
Enum.name: NOREPORT

Enum.description: Set Power On Interrupt was detected.
Enum.name: REPORTED

BitField.description: LP Section is Non-Secured Indicates that LP section was provisioned/programmed in the non-secure state
BitField.name: LPNS

Enum.description: LP section was not programmed in the non-secure state.
Enum.name: NOT_PRGRMD_IN_NON_SECURE_STATE

Enum.description: LP section was programmed in the non-secure state.
Enum.name: WAS_PRGRMD_IN_NON_SECURE_STATE

BitField.description: LP Section is Secured Indicates that the LP section is provisioned/programmed in the secure or trusted state
BitField.name: LPS

Enum.description: LP section was not programmed in secure or trusted state.
Enum.name: NOT_PRGRMD_IN_SECURE_OR_TRUSTED_STATE

Enum.description: LP section was programmed in secure or trusted state.
Enum.name: WAS_PRGRMD_IN_SECURE_OR_TRUSTED_STATE

Register.description: SNVS_LP Secure Real Time Counter MSB Register

BitField.name: SRTC

Register.description: SNVS_LP Secure Real Time Counter LSB Register
Register.name: LPSRTCLR

BitField.description: Control bit to power-down the analog bandgap reference circuitry
BitField.name: REFTOP_PWD

BitField.description: Control bit to disable the self-bias circuit in the analog bandgap
BitField.name: REFTOP_SELFBIASOFF

Enum.description: Uses coarse bias currents for startup
Enum.name: REFTOP_SELFBIASOFF_0

Enum.description: Uses bandgap-based bias currents for best performance.
Enum.name: REFTOP_SELFBIASOFF_1

BitField.description: Not related to CCM. See Power Management Unit (PMU)
BitField.name: REFTOP_VBGADJ

BitField.description: Status bit that signals the analog bandgap voltage is up and stable
BitField.name: REFTOP_VBGUP

BitField.description: Configure the analog behavior in stop mode.
BitField.name: STOP_MODE_CONFIG

Enum.description: All analog except RTC powered down on stop mode assertion.
Enum.name: STOP_MODE_CONFIG_0

Enum.description: Beside RTC, analog bandgap, 1p1 and 2p5 regulators are also on.
Enum.name: STOP_MODE_CONFIG_1

Enum.description: Beside RTC, 1p1 and 2p5 regulators are also on, low-power bandgap is selected so that the normal analog bandgap together with the rest analog is powered down.
Enum.name: STOP_MODE_CONFIG_2

Enum.description: Beside RTC, low-power bandgap is selected and the rest analog is powered down.
Enum.name: STOP_MODE_CONFIG_3

BitField.description: This bit controls a switch from VDD_HIGH_IN to VDD_SNVS_IN.
BitField.name: DISCON_HIGH_SNVS

BitField.description: This field determines the bias current in the 24MHz oscillator
BitField.name: OSC_I

BitField.description: Status bit that signals that the output of the 24-MHz crystal oscillator is stable
BitField.name: OSC_XTALOK

BitField.description: This bit enables the detector that signals when the 24MHz crystal oscillator is stable
BitField.name: OSC_XTALOK_EN

BitField.description: This bit allows disabling the clock gate (always ungated) for the xtal 24MHz clock that clocks the digital logic in the analog block
BitField.name: CLKGATE_CTRL

Enum.description: Allow the logic to automatically gate the clock when the XTAL is powered down.
Enum.name: ALLOW_AUTO_GATE

Enum.description: Prevent the logic from ever gating off the clock.
Enum.name: NO_AUTO_GATE

BitField.description: This field specifies the delay between powering up the XTAL 24MHz clock and releasing the clock to the digital logic inside the analog block
BitField.name: CLKGATE_DELAY

BitField.description: This field indicates which chip source is being used for the rtc clock
BitField.name: RTC_XTAL_SOURCE

BitField.description: This field powers down the 24M crystal oscillator if set true
BitField.name: XTAL_24M_PWD

BitField.description: Control bit to power-down the analog bandgap reference circuitry
BitField.name: REFTOP_PWD

BitField.description: Control bit to disable the self-bias circuit in the analog bandgap
BitField.name: REFTOP_SELFBIASOFF

Enum.description: Uses coarse bias currents for startup
Enum.name: REFTOP_SELFBIASOFF_0

Enum.description: Uses bandgap-based bias currents for best performance.
Enum.name: REFTOP_SELFBIASOFF_1

BitField.description: Not related to CCM. See Power Management Unit (PMU)
BitField.name: REFTOP_VBGADJ

BitField.description: Status bit that signals the analog bandgap voltage is up and stable
BitField.name: REFTOP_VBGUP

BitField.description: Configure the analog behavior in stop mode.
BitField.name: STOP_MODE_CONFIG

Enum.description: All analog except RTC powered down on stop mode assertion.
Enum.name: STOP_MODE_CONFIG_0

Enum.description: Beside RTC, analog bandgap, 1p1 and 2p5 regulators are also on.
Enum.name: STOP_MODE_CONFIG_1

Enum.description: Beside RTC, 1p1 and 2p5 regulators are also on, low-power bandgap is selected so that the normal analog bandgap together with the rest analog is powered down.
Enum.name: STOP_MODE_CONFIG_2

Enum.description: Beside RTC, low-power bandgap is selected and the rest analog is powered down.
Enum.name: STOP_MODE_CONFIG_3

Enum.description: PLL3 can be disabled when the SoC is not in any low power mode

BitField.description: This field defines the target voltage for the Arm core power domain
BitField.name: REG0_TARG

Enum.description: Power FET switched full on. No regulation.
Enum.name: REG0_TARG_31

BitField.description: This bit field defines the adjustment bits to calibrate the target value of Reg0. The adjustment is applied on top on any adjustment applied to the global reference in the misc0 register.
BitField.name: REG0_ADJ

BitField.description: This bit field defines the target voltage for the vpu/gpu power domain. Single bit increments reflect 25mV core voltage steps. Not all steps will make sense to use either because of input supply limitations or load operation.
BitField.name: REG1_TARG

Enum.description: Power FET switched full on. No regulation.
Enum.name: REG1_TARG_31

BitField.description: This bit field defines the adjustment bits to calibrate the target value of Reg1. The adjustment is applied on top on any adjustment applied to the global reference in the misc0 register.
BitField.name: REG1_ADJ

BitField.description: This field defines the target voltage for the SOC power domain
BitField.name: REG2_TARG

Enum.description: Power FET switched full on. No regulation.
Enum.name: REG2_TARG_31

BitField.description: This bit field defines the adjustment bits to calibrate the target value of Reg2. The adjustment is applied on top on any adjustment applied to the global reference in the misc0 register.
BitField.name: REG2_ADJ

BitField.description: If set, increases the gate drive on power gating FETs to reduce leakage in the off state
BitField.name: FET_ODRIVE

BitField.description: Control bit to power-down the analog bandgap reference circuitry
BitField.name: REFTOP_PWD

BitField.description: Control bit to power down the VBG-up detection circuitry in the analog bandgap.
BitField.name: REFTOP_PWDVBGUP

BitField.description: Control bit to enable the low-power mode in the analog bandgap.
BitField.name: REFTOP_LOWPOWER

BitField.description: Control bit to disable the self-bias circuit in the analog bandgap
BitField.name: REFTOP_SELFBIASOFF

Enum.description: Uses coarse bias currents for startup
Enum.name: REFTOP_SELFBIASOFF_0

Enum.description: Uses bandgap-based bias currents for best performance.
Enum.name: REFTOP_SELFBIASOFF_1

BitField.description: Status bit that signals the analog bandgap voltage is up and stable. 1 - Stable.
BitField.name: REFTOP_VBGUP

BitField.description: Configure the analog behavior in stop mode.
BitField.name: STOP_MODE_CONFIG

BitField.description: This bit controls a switch from VDD_HIGH_IN to VDD_SNVS_IN.
BitField.name: DISCON_HIGH_SNVS

BitField.description: This field determines the bias current in the 24MHz oscillator
BitField.name: OSC_I

BitField.description: Status bit that signals that the output of the 24-MHz crystal oscillator is stable
BitField.name: OSC_XTALOK

BitField.description: This bit enables the detector that signals when the 24MHz crystal oscillator is stable
BitField.name: OSC_XTALOK_EN

BitField.description: This bit allows disabling the clock gate (always ungated) for the xtal 24MHz clock that clocks the digital logic in the analog block
BitField.name: CLKGATE_CTRL

Enum.description: Allow the logic to automatically gate the clock when the XTAL is powered down.
Enum.name: ALLOW_AUTO_GATE

Enum.description: Prevent the logic from ever gating off the clock.
Enum.name: NO_AUTO_GATE

BitField.description: This field specifies the delay between powering up the XTAL 24MHz clock and releasing the clock to the digital logic inside the analog block
BitField.name: CLKGATE_DELAY

BitField.description: This field indicates which chip source is being used for the rtc clock.
BitField.name: RTC_XTAL_SOURCE

BitField.description: This field powers down the 24M crystal oscillator if set true.
BitField.name: XTAL_24M_PWD

BitField.description: Configure the analog behavior in stop mode. Not related to oscillator.
BitField.name: STOP_MODE_CONFIG

Enum.description: All analog except rtc powered down on stop mode assertion. XtalOsc=on, RCOsc=off;
Enum.name: STOP_MODE_CONFIG_0

Enum.description: Certain analog functions such as certain regulators left up. XtalOsc=on, RCOsc=off;
Enum.name: STOP_MODE_CONFIG_1

Enum.description: XtalOsc=off, RCOsc=on, Old BG=on, New BG=off.
Enum.name: STOP_MODE_CONFIG_2

Enum.description: XtalOsc=off, RCOsc=on, Old BG=off, New BG=on.
Enum.name: STOP_MODE_CONFIG_3

BitField.name: OSC_XTALOK

BitField.description: This bit enables the detector that signals when the 24MHz crystal oscillator is stable.
BitField.name: OSC_XTALOK_EN

BitField.description: This bit allows disabling the clock gate (always ungated) for the xtal 24MHz clock that clocks the digital logic in the analog block
BitField.name: CLKGATE_CTRL

Enum.description: Allow the logic to automatically gate the clock when the XTAL is powered down.
Enum.name: ALLOW_AUTO_GATE

Enum.description: Prevent the logic from ever gating off the clock.
Enum.name: NO_AUTO_GATE

BitField.description: This field specifies the delay between powering up the XTAL 24MHz clock and releasing the clock to the digital logic inside the analog block
BitField.name: CLKGATE_DELAY

BitField.description: This field indicates which chip source is being used for the rtc clock.
BitField.name: RTC_XTAL_SOURCE

BitField.description: This field powers down the 24M crystal oscillator if set true.

BitField.description: Predivider for the source clock of the PLL's. Not related to oscillator.

BitField.name: REFTOP_IBIAS_OFF

BitField.description: L1 power gate control. Used as software override. Not related to oscillator.
BitField.name: L1_PWRGATE

BitField.description: L2 power gate control. Used as software override. Not related to oscillator.
BitField.name: L2_PWRGATE

BitField.description: CPU power gate control. Used as software override. Test purpose only Not related to oscillator.
BitField.name: CPU_PWRGATE

BitField.description: Display logic power gate control. Used as software override. Not related to oscillator.
BitField.name: DISPLAY_PWRGATE

BitField.description: Specifies the time delay between when the 24MHz xtal is powered up until it is stable and ready to use
BitField.name: XTALOSC_PWRUP_DELAY

BitField.description: Display power gate control. Used as software mask. Set to zero to force ungated.
BitField.name: MIX_PWRGATE

BitField.description: GPU power gate control. Used as software mask. Set to zero to force ungated.
BitField.name: GPU_PWRGATE

BitField.description: Start/stop bit for the RC tuning calculation logic. If stopped the tuning logic is reset.
BitField.name: START

BitField.description: Enables the tuning logic to calculate new RC tuning values
BitField.name: ENABLE

BitField.description: Bypasses any calculated RC tuning value and uses the programmed register value.
BitField.name: BYPASS

BitField.description: Invert the stepping of the calculated RC tuning value.
BitField.name: INVERT

BitField.description: The current tuning value in use.
BitField.name: RC_OSC_PROG_CUR

BitField.description: The ENVADJ field adjusts the trip point for the envelope detector
BitField.name: ENVADJ

BitField.description: The DISCONADJ field adjusts the trip point for the disconnect detector: 000 = Trip-Level Voltage is 0
BitField.name: DISCONADJ

BitField.description: The ENVADJ field adjusts the trip point for the envelope detector
BitField.name: ENVADJ

BitField.description: The DISCONADJ field adjusts the trip point for the disconnect detector: 000 = Trip-Level Voltage is 0
BitField.name: DISCONADJ

BitField.description: The ENVADJ field adjusts the trip point for the envelope detector
BitField.name: ENVADJ

BitField.description: The DISCONADJ field adjusts the trip point for the disconnect detector: 000 = Trip-Level Voltage is 0
BitField.name: DISCONADJ

BitField.description: The ENVADJ field adjusts the trip point for the envelope detector
BitField.name: ENVADJ

BitField.description: The DISCONADJ field adjusts the trip point for the disconnect detector: 000 = Trip-Level Voltage is 0
BitField.name: DISCONADJ

BitField.description: For host mode, enables high-speed disconnect detector
BitField.name: ENHOSTDISCONDETECT

BitField.description: Enables interrupt for detection of disconnection to Device when in high-speed host mode
BitField.name: ENIRQHOSTDISCON

BitField.description: Indicates that the device has disconnected in high-speed mode
BitField.name: HOSTDISCONDETECT_IRQ

BitField.description: For device mode, enables 200-KOhm pullups for detecting connectivity to the host.
BitField.name: ENDEVPLUGINDETECT

BitField.description: For device mode, if this bit is cleared to 0, then it trips the interrupt if the device is plugged in
BitField.name: DEVPLUGIN_POLARITY

BitField.description: OTG ID change interrupt. Indicates the value of ID pin changed.
BitField.name: OTG_ID_CHG_IRQ

BitField.description: Enables circuit to detect resistance of MiniAB ID pin.
BitField.name: ENOTGIDDETECT

BitField.description: Set to 1 will make RESUME_IRQ bit a sticky bit until software clear it
BitField.name: RESUMEIRQSTICKY

BitField.description: Enables interrupt for detection of a non-J state on the USB line
BitField.name: ENIRQRESUMEDETECT

BitField.description: Indicates that the host is sending a wake-up after suspend
BitField.name: RESUME_IRQ

BitField.description: Enables interrupt for the detection of connectivity to the USB line.
BitField.name: ENIRQDEVPLUGIN

BitField.description: Indicates that the device is connected
BitField.name: DEVPLUGIN_IRQ

BitField.description: Enables the LRADC to monitor USB_DP and USB_DM. This is for use in non-USB modes only.
BitField.name: DATA_ON_LRADC

BitField.description: Enables UTMI+ Level2. This should be enabled if needs to support LS device
BitField.name: ENUTMILEVEL2

BitField.description: Enables interrupt for the wakeup events.
BitField.name: ENIRQWAKEUP

BitField.description: Indicates that there is a wakeup event
BitField.name: WAKEUP_IRQ

BitField.description: Enables the feature to auto-enable the POWER bit of HW_CLKCTRL_PLLxCTRL0 if there is wakeup event if USB is suspended
BitField.name: ENAUTO_PWRON_PLL

BitField.description: Enables the feature to auto-clear the CLKGATE bit if there is wakeup event while USB is suspended
BitField.name: ENAUTOCLR_CLKGATE

BitField.description: Enables the feature to auto-clear the PWD register bits in USBPHYx_PWD if there is wakeup event while USB is suspended
BitField.name: ENAUTOCLR_PHY_PWD

BitField.description: Enables the feature to wakeup USB if DP/DM is toggled when USB is suspended
BitField.name: ENDPDMCHG_WKUP

BitField.description: Enables the feature to wakeup USB if ID is toggled when USB is suspended.
BitField.name: ENIDCHG_WKUP

BitField.description: Enables the feature to wakeup USB if VBUS is toggled when USB is suspended.
BitField.name: ENVBUSCHG_WKUP

BitField.description: Enables the feature to reset the FSDLL lock detection logic at the end of each TX packet.
BitField.name: FSDLL_RST_EN

BitField.description: Almost same as OTGID_STATUS in USBPHYx_STATUS Register
BitField.name: OTG_ID_VALUE

BitField.description: Forces the next FS packet that is transmitted to have a EOP with LS timing
BitField.name: HOST_FORCE_LS_SE0

BitField.description: Used by the PHY to indicate a powered-down state
BitField.name: UTMI_SUSPENDM

BitField.description: Writing a 1 to this bit will soft-reset the USBPHYx_PWD, USBPHYx_TX, USBPHYx_RX, and USBPHYx_CTRL registers
BitField.name: SFTRST

BitField.description: Set bit 5 to 1 to override the control of the USB_DP 15-KOhm pulldown

BitField.description: Duration of RESET in terms of the number of 480-MHz cycles.

BitField.name: OTGIDPIOLOCK

BitField.description: Use holding registers to assist in timing for external UTMI interface.
BitField.name: DEBUG_INTERFACE_HOLD

BitField.description: Set bit 3 to 1 to pull down 15-KOhm on USB_DP line
BitField.name: HSTPULLDOWN

BitField.description: Set bit 5 to 1 to override the control of the USB_DP 15-KOhm pulldown
BitField.name: ENHSTPULLDOWN

BitField.description: Delay in between the end of transmit to the beginning of receive
BitField.name: TX2RXCOUNT

BitField.description: Set this bit to allow a countdown to transition in between TX and RX.
BitField.name: ENTX2RXCOUNT

BitField.description: Delay in between the detection of squelch to the reset of high-speed RX.
BitField.name: SQUELCHRESETCOUNT

BitField.description: Set bit to allow squelch to reset high-speed receive.
BitField.name: ENSQUELCHRESET

BitField.description: Duration of RESET in terms of the number of 480-MHz cycles.
BitField.name: SQUELCHRESETLENGTH

BitField.description: Choose to trigger the host resume SE0 with HOST_FORCE_LS_SE0 = 0 or UTMI_SUSPEND = 1.
BitField.name: HOST_RESUME_DEBUG

BitField.description: Running count of the failed pseudo-random generator loopback
BitField.name: LOOP_BACK_FAIL_COUNT

BitField.description: Running count of the squelch reset instead of normal end for HS RX.
BitField.name: SQUELCH_COUNT

BitField.description: Reserved. Note: This bit should remain clear.
BitField.name: RSVD0

BitField.description: Delay increment of the rise of squelch: 00 = Delay is nominal 01 = Delay is +20% 10 = Delay is -20% 11 = Delay is -40%
BitField.name: ENTAILADJVD

BitField.description: Reserved. Note: This bit should remain clear.
BitField.name: RSVD0

BitField.description: Delay increment of the rise of squelch: 00 = Delay is nominal 01 = Delay is +20% 10 = Delay is -20% 11 = Delay is -40%
BitField.name: ENTAILADJVD

BitField.description: Reserved. Note: This bit should remain clear.
BitField.name: RSVD0

BitField.description: Delay increment of the rise of squelch: 00 = Delay is nominal 01 = Delay is +20% 10 = Delay is -20% 11 = Delay is -40%
BitField.name: ENTAILADJVD

BitField.description: Reserved. Note: This bit should remain clear.
BitField.name: RSVD0

BitField.description: Delay increment of the rise of squelch: 00 = Delay is nominal 01 = Delay is +20% 10 = Delay is -20% 11 = Delay is -40%
BitField.name: ENTAILADJVD

BitField.description: Fixed read-only value reflecting the stepping of the RTL version.
BitField.name: STEP

BitField.description: Fixed read-only value reflecting the MINOR field of the RTL version.
BitField.name: MINOR

BitField.description: Fixed read-only value reflecting the MAJOR field of the RTL version.
BitField.name: MAJOR

Enum.description: When the chip is in Debug mode, the eDMA continues to operate.
Enum.name: DISABLED

Enum.description: When the chip is in debug mode, the DMA stalls the start of a new channel. Executing channels are allowed to complete.
Enum.name: ENABLED

Enum.description: Fixed priority arbitration within each group
Enum.name: DISABLED

Enum.description: Round robin arbitration within each group
Enum.name: ENABLED

Enum.description: Error causes HALT field to be automatically set to 1
Enum.name: HALT_ON_ERROR

Enum.description: The most-recently recorded error was a bus error on a destination write.
Enum.name: ERROR

Enum.description: The most-recently recorded error was a bus error on a source read.
Enum.name: ERROR

Enum.description: The most-recently recorded error was a configuration error detected in the TCDn_DLASTSGA field.
Enum.name: ERROR

Enum.description: The most-recently recorded error was a configuration error detected in the TCDn_NBYTES or TCDn_CITER fields. TCDn_NBYTES is not a multiple of TCDn_ATTR[SSIZE] and TCDn_ATTR[DSIZE], or TCDn_CITER[CITER] = 0, or TCDn_CITER[ELINK] is not equal to TCDn_BITER[ELINK].
Enum.name: ERROR

Enum.description: The most-recently recorded error was a configuration error detected in the TCDn_DOFF field. TCDn_DOFF is inconsistent with TCDn_ATTR[DSIZE].
Enum.name: ERROR

Enum.description: The most-recently recorded error was a configuration error detected in the TCDn_DADDR field. TCDn_DADDR is inconsistent with TCDn_ATTR[DSIZE].
Enum.name: ERROR

Enum.description: The most-recently recorded error was a configuration error detected in the TCDn_SOFF field. TCDn_SOFF is inconsistent with TCDn_ATTR[SSIZE].
Enum.name: ERROR

Enum.description: The most-recently recorded error was a configuration error detected in the TCDn_SADDR field. TCDn_SADDR is inconsistent with TCDn_ATTR[SSIZE].
Enum.name: ERROR

BitField.description: Error Channel Number or Canceled Channel Number
BitField.name: ERRCHN

Enum.description: The most-recently recorded error was a configuration error in the channel priorities within a group. Channel priorities within a group are not unique.
Enum.name: ERROR

Enum.description: The most-recently recorded error was a configuration error among the group priorities. All group priorities are not unique.
Enum.name: ERROR

Enum.description: The most-recently recorded entry was a canceled transfer initiated by the error cancel transfer field
Enum.name: CANCELED

BitField.description: Logical OR of all ERR status fields
BitField.name: VLD

Enum.description: At least one ERR field has a value of 1, indicating a valid error exists that has not been cleared
Enum.name: ERROR

Enum.description: Write 0 only to the EEI field specified in the CEEI field
Enum.name: CLEAR_EEI

Enum.name: CLEAR_ALL

Enum.name: NO_OPS

Enum.description: Write 1 only to the EEI field specified in the SEEI field
Enum.name: SET_EEI

Enum.description: Writes 1 to all fields in EEI
Enum.name: SET_ALL

Enum.description: No operation, ignore the other fields in this register
Enum.name: NO_OPS

Enum.description: Write 0 to only the ERQ field specified in the CERQ field
Enum.name: CLEAR_ERQ

Enum.description: Write 0 to all fields in ERQ
Enum.name: CLEAR_ALL

Enum.description: No operation, ignore the other fields in this register
Enum.name: NO_OPS

Enum.description: Write 1 to only the ERQ field specified in the SERQ field
Enum.name: SET_ERQ

Enum.description: Write 1 to all fields in ERQ
Enum.name: SET_ALL

Enum.description: No operation, ignore the other fields in this register
Enum.name: NO_OPS

Enum.description: Writes 0 to only the TCDn_CSR[DONE] field specified in the CDNE field
Enum.name: CLEAR_DONE

Enum.description: Writes 0 to all bits in TCDn_CSR[DONE]
Enum.name: CLEAR_ALL

Enum.description: No operation; all other fields in this register are ignored.
Enum.name: NO_OPS

BitField.description: Set All START fields (activates all channels)

Enum.description: Write 1 to only the TCDn_CSR[START] field specified in the SSRT field

Enum.description: Write 1 to all bits in TCDn_CSR[START]
Enum.name: SET_ALL

Enum.description: No operation; all other fields in this register are ignored.
Enum.name: NO_OPS

Enum.description: Write 0 to only the ERR field specified in the CERR field
Enum.name: CLEAR_ERR

Enum.description: Write 0 to all fields in ERR
Enum.name: CLEAR_ALL

Enum.name: NO_OPS

Enum.description: Clear only the INT field specified in the CINT field
Enum.name: CLEAR_INT

Enum.description: DMA Channel Always ON function is enabled

BitField.description: Power Control PCR must not change from power-down request (pdn_req) assertion until the target subsystem is completely powered up
BitField.name: PCR

Enum.description: Do not switch off power even if pdn_req is asserted.
Enum.name: PCR_0

Enum.description: Switch off power when pdn_req is asserted.
Enum.name: PCR_1

Register.description: PGC Mega Power Up Sequence Control Register
Register.name: PGC_MEGA_PUPSCR

BitField.description: After a power-up request (pup_req assertion), the PGC waits a number of IPG clocks equal to the value of SW before asserting power toggle on/off signal (switch_b) to switch on power
BitField.name: SW

BitField.description: After asserting power toggle on/off signal (switch_b) to switch on power, the PGC waits a number of IPG clocks equal to the value of SW2ISO before negating isolation
BitField.name: SW2ISO

Register.description: PGC Mega Pull Down Sequence Control Register
Register.name: PGC_MEGA_PDNSCR

BitField.description: After a power-down request (pdn_req assertion), the PGC waits a number of IPG clocks equal to the value of ISO before asserting isolation
BitField.name: ISO

BitField.description: After asserting isolation, the PGC waits a number of IPG clocks equal to the value of ISO2SW before negating power toggle on/off signal (switch_b) to switch off power
BitField.name: ISO2SW

Register.description: PGC Mega Power Gating Controller Status Register
Register.name: PGC_MEGA_SR

Enum.description: The target subsystem was not powered down for the previous power-down request.
Enum.name: PSR_0

Enum.description: The target subsystem was powered down for the previous power-down request.
Enum.name: PSR_1

BitField.name: SW

Register.description: PGC CPU Pull Down Sequence Control Register

BitField.description: SECONFIG[1] shows the state of the SECONFIG[1] fuse
BitField.name: SEC_CONFIG

BitField.description: BT_FUSE_SEL (connected to gpio bt_fuse_sel) shows the state of the BT_FUSE_SEL fuse
BitField.name: BT_FUSE_SEL

BitField.description: BMOD[1:0] shows the latched state of the BOOT_MODE1 and BOOT_MODE0 signals on the rising edge of POR_B
BitField.name: BMOD

BitField.description: Holds entry function for core0 for waking-up from low power mode
BitField.name: PERSISTENT_ENTRY0

BitField.description: Holds argument of entry function for core0 for waking-up from low power mode
BitField.name: PERSISTENT_ARG0

BitField.description: This field identifies which image must be used - 0/1/2/3
BitField.name: PERSIST_REDUNDANT_BOOT

BitField.description: This bit identifies which image must be used - primary and secondary
BitField.name: PERSIST_SECONDARY_BOOT

BitField.description: Oscillator ready counter value. These bits define value of 32KHz counter, that serve as counter for oscillator lock time (count to n+1 ckil's). This is used for oscillator lock time. Current estimation is ~5ms. This counter will be used in ignition sequence and in wake from stop sequence if sbyos bit was defined, to notify that on chip oscillator output is ready for the dpll_ip to use and only then the gate in dpll_ip can be opened.
BitField.name: OSCNT

BitField.description: On chip oscillator enable bit - this bit value is reflected on the output cosc_en
BitField.name: COSC_EN

BitField.description: Counter for analog_reg_bypass signal assertion after standby voltage request by PMIC_STBY_REQ

BitField.description: Status of the value of CCM_REF_EN_B output of ccm
BitField.name: REF_EN_B

BitField.description: Status indication of on board oscillator
BitField.name: COSC_READY

Enum.description: divider is not busy and its value represents the actual division.
Enum.name: SEMC_PODF_BUSY_0

Enum.description: divider is busy with handshake process with module. The value read in the divider represents the previous value of the division factor, and after the handshake the written value of the semc_podf will be applied.
Enum.name: SEMC_PODF_BUSY_1

Enum.description: divider is not busy and its value represents the actual division.
Enum.name: AHB_PODF_BUSY_0

Enum.description: divider is busy with handshake process with module. The value read in the divider represents the previous value of the division factor, and after the handshake the written value of the ahb_podf will be applied.
Enum.name: AHB_PODF_BUSY_1

BitField.name: PERIPH2_CLK_SEL_BUSY

Enum.name: PERIPH2_CLK_SEL_BUSY_0

Enum.description: mux is busy with handshake process with module. The value read in the periph2_clk_sel represents the previous value of select, and after the handshake periph2_clk_sel value will be applied.
Enum.name: PERIPH2_CLK_SEL_BUSY_1

BitField.description: Busy indicator for periph_clk_sel mux control.
BitField.name: PERIPH_CLK_SEL_BUSY

Enum.description: mux is not busy and its value represents the actual division.
Enum.name: PERIPH_CLK_SEL_BUSY_0

Enum.name: PERIPH_CLK_SEL_BUSY_1

Enum.description: divider is not busy and its value represents the actual division.
Enum.name: ARM_PODF_BUSY_0

Enum.description: divider is busy with handshake process with module. The value read in the divider represents the previous value of the division factor, and after the handshake the written value of the arm_podf will be applied.
Enum.name: ARM_PODF_BUSY_1

BitField.description: Setting the low power mode that system will enter on next assertion of dsm_request signal.
BitField.name: LPM

BitField.description: Define if Arm clocks (arm_clk, soc_mxclk, soc_pclk, soc_dbg_pclk, vl_wrck) will be disabled on wait mode
BitField.name: ARM_CLK_DIS_ON_LPM

Enum.description: Arm clock enabled on wait mode.
Enum.name: ARM_CLK_DIS_ON_LPM_0

Enum.description: Arm clock disabled on wait mode. .
Enum.name: ARM_CLK_DIS_ON_LPM_1

Enum.description: On-chip oscillator will not be powered down, after next entrance to STOP mode. (CCM_REF_EN_B will remain asserted - '0' and cosc_pwrdown will remain de asserted - '0')
Enum.name: SBYOS_0

Enum.description: On-chip oscillator will be powered down, after next entrance to STOP mode. (CCM_REF_EN_B will be deasserted - '1' and cosc_pwrdown will be asserted - '1'). When returning from STOP mode, external oscillator will be enabled again, on-chip oscillator will return to oscillator mode, and after oscnt count, CCM will continue with the exit from the STOP mode process.
Enum.name: SBYOS_1

BitField.description: dis_ref_osc - in run mode, software can manually control closing of external reference oscillator clock, i
BitField.name: DIS_REF_OSC

Enum.description: external high frequency oscillator will be enabled, i.e. CCM_REF_EN_B = '0'.
Enum.name: DIS_REF_OSC_0

Enum.description: external high frequency oscillator will be disabled, i.e. CCM_REF_EN_B = '1'
Enum.name: DIS_REF_OSC_1

Enum.description: Voltage will not be changed to standby voltage after next entrance to STOP mode. ( PMIC_STBY_REQ will remain negated - '0')
Enum.name: VSTBY_0

Enum.description: Voltage will be requested to change to standby voltage after next entrance to stop mode. ( PMIC_STBY_REQ will be asserted - '1').
Enum.name: VSTBY_1

Enum.description: CCM will wait (1*pmic_delay_scaler)+1 ckil clock cycles
Enum.name: STBY_COUNT_0

Enum.description: CCM will wait (3*pmic_delay_scaler)+1 ckil clock cycles
Enum.name: STBY_COUNT_1

Enum.description: CCM will wait (7*pmic_delay_scaler)+1 ckil clock cycles
Enum.name: STBY_COUNT_2

Enum.description: CCM will wait (15*pmic_delay_scaler)+1 ckil clock cycles
Enum.name: STBY_COUNT_3

BitField.description: In run mode, software can manually control powering down of on chip oscillator, i
BitField.name: COSC_PWRDOWN

Enum.description: On chip oscillator will not be powered down, i.e. cosc_pwrdown = '0'.
Enum.name: COSC_PWRDOWN_0

Enum.description: On chip oscillator will be powered down, i.e. cosc_pwrdown = '1'.

BitField.description: Defines the value of the output signal cgpr_dout[4]. Gate of program supply for efuse programing
BitField.name: EFUSE_PROG_SUPPLY_GATE

Enum.description: fuse programing supply voltage is gated off to the efuse module
Enum.name: EFUSE_PROG_SUPPLY_GATE_0

Enum.description: Enable memory (outside Arm platform) DS mode when system STOP and PLL are disabled
Enum.name: SYS_MEM_DS_CTRL_1

Enum.description: enable memory (outside Arm platform) DS mode when system is in STOP mode
Enum.name: SYS_MEM_DS_CTRL_2

Enum.description: Engage PLL enable 3 CKIL clocks earlier at exiting low power mode (STOP). Should be used only if 24MHz OSC was active in low power mode.
Enum.name: FPL_1

BitField.description: Control for the Deep Sleep signal to the Arm Platform memories with additional control logic based on the Arm WFI signal
BitField.name: INT_MEM_CLK_LPM

Enum.description: Disable the clock to the Arm platform memories when entering Low Power Mode
Enum.name: INT_MEM_CLK_LPM_0

Enum.description: Keep the clocks to the Arm platform memories enabled only if an interrupt is pending when entering Low Power Modes (WAIT and STOP without power gating)
Enum.name: INT_MEM_CLK_LPM_1

BitField.description: The OCRAM clock cannot be turned off when the CM cache is running on this device.
BitField.name: CG14

BitField.description: flexspi clocks (flexspi_clk_enable) sim_ems_clk_enable must also be cleared, when flexspi_clk_enable is cleared
BitField.name: CG5

BitField.description: Overide clock enable signal from GPT - clock will not be gated based on GPT's signal 'ipg_enable_clk'
BitField.name: MOD_EN_OV_GPT

BitField.description: Overide clock enable signal from PIT - clock will not be gated based on PIT's signal 'ipg_enable_clk'
BitField.name: MOD_EN_OV_PIT

BitField.description: Overide clock enable signal from TRNG
BitField.name: MOD_EN_OV_TRNG

Enum.description: Standard feature set with MODEM/IrDA support.
Enum.name: MODEM

Enum.description: Input trigger is used instead of RXD pin input.
Enum.name: TRG_RXD

Enum.description: Input trigger is used instead of CTS_B pin input.
Enum.name: TRG_CTS

Enum.description: Input trigger is used to modulate the TXD pin output. The TXD pin output (after TXINV configuration) is internally ANDed with the input trigger.
Enum.name: TRG_TXD

BitField.description: RX Input Active Edge Interrupt Enable
BitField.name: RXEDGIE

Enum.description: Hardware interrupts from STAT[RXEDGIF] are disabled.
Enum.name: DISABLE

Enum.description: Hardware interrupt is requested when STAT[RXEDGIF] flag is 1.
Enum.name: ENABLE

Enum.description: Hardware interrupts from STAT[LBKDIF] flag are disabled (use polling).
Enum.name: DISABLE

Enum.description: Hardware interrupt is requested when STAT[LBKDIF] flag is 1.
Enum.name: ENABLE

Enum.description: Resynchronization during received data word is supported.
Enum.name: RESYNC

Enum.description: Resynchronization during received data word is disabled.
Enum.name: NO_RESYNC

Enum.description: Receiver samples input data using the rising edge of the baud rate clock.
Enum.name: DISABLED

Enum.description: Receiver samples input data using the rising and falling edge of the baud rate clock.
Enum.name: ENABLED

Enum.description: Enables RWU on Data Match and Match On/Off for transmitter CTS input
Enum.name: RWU_MATCH

Enum.description: Writing 0 to this field results in an oversampling ratio of 16
Enum.name: DEFAULT

Enum.description: Oversampling ratio of 4, requires BOTHEDGE to be set.
Enum.name: OSR_4

Enum.description: Oversampling ratio of 5, requires BOTHEDGE to be set.
Enum.name: OSR_5

Enum.description: Oversampling ratio of 6, requires BOTHEDGE to be set.
Enum.name: OSR_6

Enum.description: Oversampling ratio of 7, requires BOTHEDGE to be set.
Enum.name: OSR_7

Enum.description: Receiver and transmitter use 7-bit to 9-bit data characters.
Enum.name: DISABLED

Enum.description: Receiver and transmitter use 10-bit data characters.
Enum.name: ENABLED

Enum.description: Enables automatic address matching or data matching mode for MATCH[MA2].
Enum.name: ENABLED

Enum.description: Enables automatic address matching or data matching mode for MATCH[MA1].
Enum.name: ENABLED

Enum.description: Received data is not equal to MA2
Enum.name: NOMATCH

Enum.description: Received data is equal to MA2
Enum.name: MATCH

Enum.description: Received data is not equal to MA1
Enum.name: NOMATCH

Enum.description: Received data is equal to MA1
Enum.name: MATCH

Enum.description: No framing error detected. This does not guarantee the framing is correct.
Enum.name: NOERROR

Enum.description: Noise detected in the received character in the DATA register.
Enum.name: NOISE

Enum.description: Receive FIFO level is less than watermark.
Enum.name: NO_RXDATA

Enum.description: Receive FIFO level is equal or greater than watermark.
Enum.name: RXDATA

Enum.description: Transmitter active (sending data, a preamble, or a break).
Enum.name: ACTIVE

Enum.description: Transmit FIFO level is greater than watermark.
Enum.name: TXDATA

Enum.description: Transmit FIFO level is equal or less than watermark.
Enum.name: NO_TXDATA

Enum.description: LPUART receiver idle waiting for a start bit.
Enum.name: IDLE

Enum.description: LPUART receiver active (RXD input not idle).
Enum.name: ACTIVE

Enum.description: LIN break detect is disabled, normal break character can be detected.
Enum.name: DISABLED

Enum.description: LIN break detect is enabled. LIN break character is detected at length of 11 bit times (if M = 0) or 12 (if M = 1) or 13 (M10 = 1).
Enum.name: ENABLED

Enum.description: Break character is transmitted with length of 9 to 13 bit times.
Enum.name: SHORT

Enum.description: Break character is transmitted with length of 12 to 15 bit times.
Enum.name: LONG

Enum.description: During receive standby state (RWU = 1), the IDLE bit does not get set upon detection of an idle character. During address match wakeup, the IDLE bit does not set when an address does not match.
Enum.name: IDLE_NOTSET

Enum.description: During receive standby state (RWU = 1), the IDLE bit gets set upon detection of an idle character. During address match wakeup, the IDLE bit does set when an address does not match.
Enum.name: IDLE_SET

Enum.description: LSB (bit0) is the first bit that is transmitted following the start bit. Further, the first bit received after the start bit is identified as bit0.
Enum.name: LSB_FIRST

Enum.description: MSB (identified as bit9, bit8, bit7 or bit6) is the first bit that is transmitted following the start bit depending on the setting of CTRL[M], CTRL[PE] and BAUD[M10]. .
Enum.name: MSB_FIRST

BitField.description: RXD Pin Active Edge Interrupt Flag
BitField.name: RXEDGIF

Enum.description: No active edge on the receive pin has occurred.
Enum.name: NO_EDGE

Enum.description: An active edge on the receive pin has occurred.
Enum.name: EDGE

Enum.description: No LIN break character has been detected.
Enum.name: NOT_DETECTED

Enum.description: LIN break character has been detected.
Enum.name: DETECTED

Enum.description: No hardware parity generation or checking.
Enum.name: DISABLED

Enum.description: Idle character bit count starts after start bit.
Enum.name: FROM_START

Enum.description: Idle character bit count starts after stop bit.
Enum.name: FROM_STOP

Enum.description: Receiver and transmitter use 8-bit data characters.
Enum.name: DATA8

Enum.description: Receiver and transmitter use 9-bit data characters.
Enum.name: DATA9

Enum.description: Provided LOOPS is set, RSRC is cleared, selects internal loop back mode and the LPUART does not use the RXD pin.
Enum.name: NO_EFFECT

Enum.description: Single-wire LPUART mode where the TXD pin is connected to the transmitter output and receiver input.
Enum.name: ONEWIRE

Enum.description: LPUART is enabled in Doze mode.
Enum.name: ENABLED

Enum.description: LPUART is disabled in Doze mode .
Enum.name: DISABLED

Enum.description: Normal operation - RXD and TXD use separate pins.
Enum.name: NOFFECT

Enum.description: Loop mode or single-wire mode where transmitter outputs are internally connected to receiver input (see RSRC bit).
Enum.name: LOOPBACK

Enum.description: Receiver and transmitter use 8-bit to 10-bit data characters.
Enum.name: NO_EFFECT

Enum.description: Receiver and transmitter use 7-bit data characters.
Enum.name: DATA7

Enum.name: TX_BREAK

Enum.name: RX_WAKEUP

Enum.description: Hardware interrupts from IDLE disabled; use polling.
Enum.name: DISABLED

Enum.description: Hardware interrupt is requested when TC flag is 1.

Enum.description: Hardware interrupt is requested when TDRE flag is 1.

BitField.description: TXD Pin Direction in Single-Wire Mode
BitField.name: TXDIR

Enum.description: TXD pin is an input in single-wire mode.
Enum.name: TX_INPUT

Enum.description: TXD pin is an output in single-wire mode.
Enum.name: TX_OUTPUT

Enum.description: Receiver was not idle before receiving this character.
Enum.name: NO_IDLE

Enum.description: Receiver was idle before receiving this character.
Enum.name: IDLE

Enum.description: Receive buffer is empty, data returned on read is not valid.
Enum.name: EMPTY

Enum.description: The dataword is received without a frame error on read, or transmit a normal character on write.
Enum.name: NO_ERROR

Enum.description: The dataword is received with a frame error, or transmit an idle or break character on transmit.
Enum.name: ERROR

Enum.description: The dataword is received without a parity error.
Enum.name: NO_PARITY

Enum.description: The dataword is received with a parity error.
Enum.name: PARITY

Enum.description: The dataword is received without noise.
Enum.name: NO_NOISE

Enum.description: The data is received with noise.
Enum.name: NOISE

Enum.description: CTS has no effect on the transmitter.
Enum.name: DISABLED

Enum.description: Enables clear-to-send operation. The transmitter checks the state of CTS each time it is ready to send a character. If CTS is asserted, the character is sent. If CTS is deasserted, the signal TXD remains in the mark state and transmission is delayed until CTS is asserted. Changes in CTS as a character is being sent do not affect its transmission.
Enum.name: ENABLED

Enum.description: The transmitter has no effect on RTS.
Enum.name: DISABLED

Enum.description: When a character is placed into an empty transmit shift register, RTS asserts one bit time before the start bit is transmitted. RTS deasserts one bit time after all characters in the transmitter FIFO and shift register are completely sent, including the last stop bit.
Enum.name: ENABLED

Enum.description: The receiver has no effect on RTS.
Enum.name: DISABLED

Enum.description: RTS is deasserted if the receiver data register is full or a start bit has been detected that would cause the receiver data register to become full. RTS is asserted if the receiver data register is not full and has not detected a start bit that would cause the receiver data register to become full.
Enum.name: ENABLED

Enum.description: CTS input is sampled at the start of each character.
Enum.name: START

Enum.description: CTS input is sampled when the transmitter is idle.
Enum.name: IDLE

Enum.description: CTS input is the CTS_B pin.
Enum.name: CTS

Enum.description: CTS input is an internal connection to the receiver address match result.
Enum.name: MATCH

Enum.description: Receive FIFO is not enabled. Buffer depth is 1.
Enum.name: DISABLED

Enum.description: Receive FIFO is enabled. Buffer depth is indicted by RXFIFOSIZE.
Enum.name: ENABLED

Enum.description: Transmit FIFO is not enabled. Buffer depth is 1.
Enum.name: DISABLED

Enum.description: Transmit FIFO is enabled. Buffer depth is indicated by TXFIFOSIZE.
Enum.name: ENABLED

Enum.description: RXUF flag does not generate an interrupt to the host.
Enum.name: DISABLED

Enum.description: RXUF flag generates an interrupt to the host.
Enum.name: ENABLED

Enum.description: TXOF flag does not generate an interrupt to the host.
Enum.name: DISABLED

Enum.description: TXOF flag generates an interrupt to the host.
Enum.name: ENABLED

Enum.description: Disable RDRF assertion due to partially filled FIFO when receiver is idle.
Enum.name: DISABLED

Enum.description: Enable RDRF assertion due to partially filled FIFO when receiver is idle for 1 character.
Enum.name: IDLE_1

Enum.description: Enable RDRF assertion due to partially filled FIFO when receiver is idle for 2 characters.
Enum.name: IDLE_2

Enum.description: Enable RDRF assertion due to partially filled FIFO when receiver is idle for 4 characters.
Enum.name: IDLE_4

Enum.description: Enable RDRF assertion due to partially filled FIFO when receiver is idle for 8 characters.
Enum.name: IDLE_8

Enum.description: Enable RDRF assertion due to partially filled FIFO when receiver is idle for 16 characters.
Enum.name: IDLE_16

Enum.description: Enable RDRF assertion due to partially filled FIFO when receiver is idle for 32 characters.
Enum.name: IDLE_32

Enum.description: Enable RDRF assertion due to partially filled FIFO when receiver is idle for 64 characters.
Enum.name: IDLE_64

Enum.description: All data in the receive FIFO/buffer is cleared out.
Enum.name: RXFIFO_RST

Enum.description: All data in the transmit FIFO is cleared out.
Enum.name: TXFIFO_RST

Enum.description: No receive FIFO underflow has occurred since the last time the flag was cleared.
Enum.name: NO_UNDERFLOW

Enum.description: At least one receive FIFO underflow has occurred since the last time the flag was cleared.
Enum.name: UNDERFLOW

Enum.description: No transmit FIFO overflow has occurred since the last time the flag was cleared.
Enum.name: NO_OVERFLOW

Enum.description: At least one transmit FIFO overflow has occurred since the last time the flag was cleared.
Enum.name: OVERFLOW

Enum.description: Hardware interrupts from STAT[LBKDIF] flag are disabled (use polling).
Enum.name: DISABLE

Enum.name: ENABLE

Enum.description: Resynchronization during received data word is supported.
Enum.name: RESYNC

Enum.description: Resynchronization during received data word is disabled.
Enum.name: NO_RESYNC

Enum.name: DISABLED

Enum.description: Receiver samples input data using the rising and falling edge of the baud rate clock.
Enum.name: ENABLED

Enum.description: Enables RWU on Data Match and Match On/Off for transmitter CTS input
Enum.name: RWU_MATCH

Enum.description: Writing 0 to this field results in an oversampling ratio of 16
Enum.name: DEFAULT

Enum.description: Oversampling ratio of 4, requires BOTHEDGE to be set.
Enum.name: OSR_4

Enum.name: OSR_5

Enum.name: OSR_6

Enum.name: OSR_7

Enum.description: Receiver and transmitter use 7-bit to 9-bit data characters.
Enum.name: DISABLED

Enum.description: Receiver and transmitter use 10-bit data characters.
Enum.name: ENABLED

Enum.description: Enables automatic address matching or data matching mode for MATCH[MA2].
Enum.name: ENABLED

Enum.description: Enables automatic address matching or data matching mode for MATCH[MA1].
Enum.name: ENABLED

Enum.description: Received data is not equal to MA2
Enum.name: NOMATCH

Enum.description: Received data is equal to MA2
Enum.name: MATCH

Enum.description: Received data is not equal to MA1
Enum.name: NOMATCH

Enum.description: Received data is equal to MA1
Enum.name: MATCH

Enum.description: No framing error detected. This does not guarantee the framing is correct.
Enum.name: NOERROR

Enum.description: Noise detected in the received character in the DATA register.
Enum.name: NOISE

Enum.description: Receive FIFO level is less than watermark.
Enum.name: NO_RXDATA

Enum.description: Receive FIFO level is equal or greater than watermark.
Enum.name: RXDATA

Enum.description: Transmitter active (sending data, a preamble, or a break).
Enum.name: ACTIVE

Enum.description: Transmit FIFO level is greater than watermark.
Enum.name: TXDATA

Enum.description: Transmit FIFO level is equal or less than watermark.
Enum.name: NO_TXDATA

Enum.description: LPUART receiver idle waiting for a start bit.
Enum.name: IDLE

Enum.description: LPUART receiver active (RXD input not idle).
Enum.name: ACTIVE

Enum.description: LIN break detect is disabled, normal break character can be detected.
Enum.name: DISABLED

Enum.description: LIN break detect is enabled. LIN break character is detected at length of 11 bit times (if M = 0) or 12 (if M = 1) or 13 (M10 = 1).
Enum.name: ENABLED

Enum.description: Break character is transmitted with length of 9 to 13 bit times.
Enum.name: SHORT

Enum.description: Break character is transmitted with length of 12 to 15 bit times.
Enum.name: LONG

Enum.description: During receive standby state (RWU = 1), the IDLE bit does not get set upon detection of an idle character. During address match wakeup, the IDLE bit does not set when an address does not match.
Enum.name: IDLE_NOTSET

Enum.description: During receive standby state (RWU = 1), the IDLE bit gets set upon detection of an idle character. During address match wakeup, the IDLE bit does set when an address does not match.
Enum.name: IDLE_SET

Enum.description: LSB (bit0) is the first bit that is transmitted following the start bit. Further, the first bit received after the start bit is identified as bit0.
Enum.name: LSB_FIRST

Enum.description: MSB (identified as bit9, bit8, bit7 or bit6) is the first bit that is transmitted following the start bit depending on the setting of CTRL[M], CTRL[PE] and BAUD[M10]. .
Enum.name: MSB_FIRST

BitField.description: RXD Pin Active Edge Interrupt Flag
BitField.name: RXEDGIF

Enum.name: NOT_DETECTED

Enum.description: LIN break character has been detected.

Enum.name: DISABLED

Enum.description: Idle character bit count starts after start bit.
Enum.name: FROM_START

Enum.description: Receiver and transmitter use 9-bit data characters.

Enum.description: Receiver was not idle before receiving this character.
Enum.name: NO_IDLE

Enum.description: Receiver was idle before receiving this character.
Enum.name: IDLE

Enum.description: Receive buffer is empty, data returned on read is not valid.
Enum.name: EMPTY

Enum.description: The dataword is received without a frame error on read, or transmit a normal character on write.
Enum.name: NO_ERROR

Enum.description: The dataword is received with a frame error, or transmit an idle or break character on transmit.
Enum.name: ERROR

Enum.description: The dataword is received without a parity error.
Enum.name: NO_PARITY

Enum.description: The dataword is received with a parity error.
Enum.name: PARITY

Enum.description: The dataword is received without noise.
Enum.name: NO_NOISE

Enum.description: The data is received with noise.
Enum.name: NOISE

Enum.description: CTS has no effect on the transmitter.
Enum.name: DISABLED

Enum.description: Enables clear-to-send operation. The transmitter checks the state of CTS each time it is ready to send a character. If CTS is asserted, the character is sent. If CTS is deasserted, the signal TXD remains in the mark state and transmission is delayed until CTS is asserted. Changes in CTS as a character is being sent do not affect its transmission.
Enum.name: ENABLED

Enum.description: The transmitter has no effect on RTS.
Enum.name: DISABLED

Enum.description: When a character is placed into an empty transmit shift register, RTS asserts one bit time before the start bit is transmitted. RTS deasserts one bit time after all characters in the transmitter FIFO and shift register are completely sent, including the last stop bit.
Enum.name: ENABLED

Enum.description: The receiver has no effect on RTS.
Enum.name: DISABLED

Enum.description: RTS is deasserted if the receiver data register is full or a start bit has been detected that would cause the receiver data register to become full. RTS is asserted if the receiver data register is not full and has not detected a start bit that would cause the receiver data register to become full.
Enum.name: ENABLED

Enum.description: CTS input is sampled at the start of each character.
Enum.name: START

Enum.description: CTS input is sampled when the transmitter is idle.
Enum.name: IDLE

Enum.description: CTS input is the CTS_B pin.
Enum.name: CTS

Enum.description: CTS input is an internal connection to the receiver address match result.
Enum.name: MATCH

Enum.description: Receive FIFO is not enabled. Buffer depth is 1.
Enum.name: DISABLED

Enum.description: Receive FIFO is enabled. Buffer depth is indicted by RXFIFOSIZE.
Enum.name: ENABLED

Enum.description: Transmit FIFO is not enabled. Buffer depth is 1.
Enum.name: DISABLED

Enum.description: Transmit FIFO is enabled. Buffer depth is indicated by TXFIFOSIZE.
Enum.name: ENABLED

Enum.description: RXUF flag does not generate an interrupt to the host.
Enum.name: DISABLED

Enum.description: RXUF flag generates an interrupt to the host.
Enum.name: ENABLED

Enum.description: TXOF flag does not generate an interrupt to the host.
Enum.name: DISABLED

Enum.description: TXOF flag generates an interrupt to the host.
Enum.name: ENABLED

Enum.description: Disable RDRF assertion due to partially filled FIFO when receiver is idle.

Enum.name: IDLE_1

Enum.description: All data in the transmit FIFO is cleared out.
Enum.name: TXFIFO_RST

Enum.name: UNDERFLOW

Enum.description: No transmit FIFO overflow has occurred since the last time the flag was cleared.

Enum.description: Clear OFLAG output on successful compare
Enum.name: CLEAR_OFLAG

Enum.description: Set OFLAG output on successful compare
Enum.name: SET_OFLAG

Enum.description: Toggle OFLAG output on successful compare
Enum.name: TOGGLE_OFLAG_SUCCESS

Enum.description: Toggle OFLAG output using alternating compare registers
Enum.name: TOGGLE_OFLAG_ALT

Enum.description: Set on compare, cleared on secondary source input edge
Enum.name: CLEAR_ON_SECONDARY

Enum.description: Set on compare, cleared on counter rollover
Enum.name: CLEAR_ON_ROLLOVER

Enum.description: Enable gated clock output while counter is active
Enum.name: ENABLE_GATED_OUT

Enum.description: Co-channel counter/timers cannot force a re-initialization of this counter/timer
Enum.name: DISABLE

Enum.description: Co-channel counter/timers may force a re-initialization of this counter/timer
Enum.name: ENABLE

Enum.description: Count until roll over at $FFFF and continue from $0000.
Enum.name: UNTIL_ROLLOVER

Enum.description: Count until compare, then re-initialize. If counting up, a successful compare occurs when the counter reaches a COMP1 value. If counting down, a successful compare occurs when the counter reaches a COMP2 value. When output mode $4 is used, alternating values of COMP1 and COMP2 are used to generate successful comparisons. For example, the counter counts until a COMP1 value is reached, re-initializes, counts until COMP2 value is reached, re-initializes, counts until COMP1 value is reached, and so on.
Enum.name: UNTIL_COMPARE

Enum.description: Count until compare and then stop. If counting up, a successful compare occurs when the counter reaches a COMP1 value. If counting down, a successful compare occurs when the counter reaches a COMP2 value. When output mode $4 is used, the counter re-initializes after reaching the COMP1 value, continues to count to the COMP2 value, and then stops.
Enum.name: UNTIL_COMPARE

Enum.description: IP bus clock divide by 1 prescaler
Enum.name: BUS_DIVBY1

Enum.description: IP bus clock divide by 2 prescaler
Enum.name: BUS_DIVBY2

Enum.description: IP bus clock divide by 4 prescaler
Enum.name: BUS_DIVBY4

Enum.description: IP bus clock divide by 8 prescaler
Enum.name: BUS_DIVBY8

Enum.description: IP bus clock divide by 16 prescaler
Enum.name: BUS_DIVBY16

Enum.description: IP bus clock divide by 32 prescaler
Enum.name: BUS_DIVBY32

Enum.description: IP bus clock divide by 64 prescaler
Enum.name: BUS_DIVBY64

Enum.description: IP bus clock divide by 128 prescaler
Enum.name: BUS_DIVBY128

Enum.description: Count rising edges of primary sourceRising edges are counted only when SCTRL[IPS] = 0. Falling edges are counted when SCTRL[IPS] = 1. If the primary count source is IP bus clock divide by 1, only rising edges are counted regardless of the value of SCTRL[IPS].
Enum.name: RISING_ONLY

Enum.description: Count rising and falling edges of primary sourceIP bus clock divide by 1 cannot be used as a primary count source in edge count mode.
Enum.name: RISING_AND_FALLING

Enum.description: Count rising edges of primary source while secondary input high active
Enum.name: RISING_WHILE_SEC_HIGH

Enum.description: Quadrature count mode, uses primary and secondary sources
Enum.name: QUADRATURE

Enum.description: Count rising edges of primary source; secondary source specifies directionRising edges are counted only when SCTRL[IPS] = 0. Falling edges are counted when SCTRL[IPS] = 1.
Enum.name: RISING_SEC_DIR

Enum.description: Edge of secondary source triggers primary count until compare
Enum.name: SECONDARY

Enum.description: Cascaded counter mode (up/down)The primary count source must be set to one of the counter outputs.
Enum.name: CASCADE

Register.description: Timer Channel Status and Control Register
Register.name: SCTRL0

Enum.description: The external pin is configured as an input.
Enum.name: INPUT

Enum.description: The OFLAG output signal is driven on the external pin. Other timer groups using this external pin as their input see the driven value. The polarity of the signal is determined by OPS.
Enum.name: OFLAG_OUT

Enum.description: Load capture register on rising edge (when IPS=0) or falling edge (when IPS=1) of input
Enum.name: ENABLE_RISING

Enum.description: Load capture register on falling edge (when IPS=0) or rising edge (when IPS=1) of input
Enum.name: ENABLE_FALLING

Enum.description: Load capture register on both edges of input
Enum.name: ENABLE_BOTH

Register.description: Timer Channel Comparator Status and Control Register
Register.name: CSCTRL0

Enum.description: Load upon successful compare with the value in COMP1
Enum.name: COMP1

Enum.description: Load upon successful compare with the value in COMP2
Enum.name: COMP2

Enum.description: Load upon successful compare with the value in COMP1
Enum.name: COMP1

Enum.description: Load upon successful compare with the value in COMP2
Enum.name: COMP2

Enum.description: The last count was in the DOWN direction.
Enum.name: DOWN

Enum.description: The last count was in the UP direction.
Enum.name: UP

Enum.description: Stop counter upon receiving a second trigger event while still counting from the first trigger event.
Enum.name: STOP

Enum.description: Reload the counter upon receiving a second trigger event while still counting from the first trigger event.
Enum.name: RELOAD

Enum.description: Do not reload the counter on a capture event.
Enum.name: DISABLE

Enum.description: Reload the counter on a capture event.
Enum.name: ENABLE

Enum.description: Counter can be re-initialized only with the LOAD register.
Enum.name: DISABLE

Enum.description: Counter can be re-initialized with the LOAD or CMPLD2 registers depending on count direction.
Enum.name: ENABLE

Enum.description: Continue with normal operation during debug mode. (default)
Enum.name: NORMAL

Enum.description: Halt TMR counter during debug mode.
Enum.name: HALT_TMR

Enum.description: Force TMR output to logic 0 (prior to consideration of SCTRL[OPS]).
Enum.name: FORCE_0

Enum.description: Both halt counter and force output to 0 during debug mode.
Enum.name: HALT_AND_FORCE_0

Enum.description: Clear OFLAG output on successful compare
Enum.name: CLEAR_OFLAG

Enum.description: Set OFLAG output on successful compare
Enum.name: SET_OFLAG

Enum.description: Toggle OFLAG output on successful compare
Enum.name: TOGGLE_OFLAG_SUCCESS

Enum.description: Toggle OFLAG output using alternating compare registers
Enum.name: TOGGLE_OFLAG_ALT

Enum.description: Set on compare, cleared on secondary source input edge
Enum.name: CLEAR_ON_SECONDARY

Enum.description: Set on compare, cleared on counter rollover
Enum.name: CLEAR_ON_ROLLOVER

Enum.description: Enable gated clock output while counter is active
Enum.name: ENABLE_GATED_OUT

Enum.description: Co-channel counter/timers cannot force a re-initialization of this counter/timer
Enum.name: DISABLE

Enum.description: Co-channel counter/timers may force a re-initialization of this counter/timer
Enum.name: ENABLE

Enum.description: Count until roll over at $FFFF and continue from $0000.
Enum.name: UNTIL_ROLLOVER

Enum.description: Count until compare, then re-initialize. If counting up, a successful compare occurs when the counter reaches a COMP1 value. If counting down, a successful compare occurs when the counter reaches a COMP2 value. When output mode $4 is used, alternating values of COMP1 and COMP2 are used to generate successful comparisons. For example, the counter counts until a COMP1 value is reached, re-initializes, counts until COMP2 value is reached, re-initializes, counts until COMP1 value is reached, and so on.
Enum.name: UNTIL_COMPARE

Enum.description: Count until compare and then stop. If counting up, a successful compare occurs when the counter reaches a COMP1 value. If counting down, a successful compare occurs when the counter reaches a COMP2 value. When output mode $4 is used, the counter re-initializes after reaching the COMP1 value, continues to count to the COMP2 value, and then stops.
Enum.name: UNTIL_COMPARE

Enum.description: Count rising edges of primary sourceRising edges are counted only when SCTRL[IPS] = 0. Falling edges are counted when SCTRL[IPS] = 1. If the primary count source is IP bus clock divide by 1, only rising edges are counted regardless of the value of SCTRL[IPS].
Enum.name: RISING_ONLY

Enum.description: Count rising and falling edges of primary sourceIP bus clock divide by 1 cannot be used as a primary count source in edge count mode.
Enum.name: RISING_AND_FALLING

Enum.description: Count rising edges of primary source while secondary input high active
Enum.name: RISING_WHILE_SEC_HIGH

Enum.description: Quadrature count mode, uses primary and secondary sources
Enum.name: QUADRATURE

Enum.description: Count rising edges of primary source; secondary source specifies directionRising edges are counted only when SCTRL[IPS] = 0. Falling edges are counted when SCTRL[IPS] = 1.
Enum.name: RISING_SEC_DIR

Enum.description: Edge of secondary source triggers primary count until compare
Enum.name: SECONDARY

Enum.description: Cascaded counter mode (up/down)The primary count source must be set to one of the counter outputs.
Enum.name: CASCADE
