BitField.description: Disables dynamic read allocate mode for Write-Back Write-Allocate memory regions.
BitField.name: DISRAMODE

BitField.description: Disables ITM and DWT ATB flush.
BitField.name: DISITMATBFLUSH

Enum.description: ITM and DWT ATB flush disabled, this bit is always 1.
Enum.name: DISITMATBFLUSH_1

Enum.description: BTAC is not used and only static branch prediction can occur.
Enum.name: DISBTACREAD_1

Enum.description: No new entries are allocated in Branch Target Address Cache (BTAC), but existing entries can be updated.
Enum.name: DISBTACALLOC_1

Enum.description: An AXI read to Strongly-Ordered or Device memory, or an LDREX to Shareable memory, is not put on AXI if there are any outstanding reads on AXI. Transactions on AXI cannot be interrupted. This bit might reduce the time that these transactions are in progress and might improve worst case interrupt latency. Performance is decreased when this bit is set.
Enum.name: DISCRITAXIRUR_1

Enum.description: Nothing can be dual-issued when this instruction type is in channel 0.
Enum.name: DISDI_1

Enum.description: Nothing can be dual-issued when this instruction type is in channel 1.
Enum.name: DISISSCH1_1

BitField.description: Disables dynamic allocation of ADD and SUB instructions
BitField.name: DISDYNADD

Enum.description: Normal operation. Some ADD and SUB instrctions are resolved in EX1.
Enum.name: DISDYNADD_0

Enum.description: All ADD and SUB instructions are resolved in EX2.
Enum.name: DISDYNADD_1

Enum.description: Normal operation. This is backwards compatible with r0.
Enum.name: DISCRITAXIRUW_0

Enum.description: AXI reads to DEV/SO memory. Exclusive reads to Shareable memory are not initiated on the AXIM AR channel until all outstanding stores on AXI are complete.
Enum.name: DISCRITAXIRUW_1

BitField.description: Indicates whether there are preempted active exceptions
BitField.name: RETTOBASE

Enum.description: there are preempted active exceptions to execute
Enum.name: RETTOBASE_0

Enum.description: there are no active exceptions, or the currently-executing exception is the only active exception
Enum.name: RETTOBASE_1

BitField.description: Exception number of the highest priority pending enabled exception
BitField.name: VECTPENDING

BitField.description: Interrupt pending flag, excluding NMI and Faults
BitField.name: ISRPENDING

Enum.description: removes the pending state from the SysTick exception
Enum.name: PENDSTCLR_1

Enum.description: write: no effect; read: SysTick exception is not pending
Enum.name: PENDSTSET_0

Enum.description: write: changes SysTick exception state to pending; read: SysTick exception is pending
Enum.name: PENDSTSET_1

Enum.description: removes the pending state from the PendSV exception
Enum.name: PENDSVCLR_1

Enum.description: write: no effect; read: PendSV exception is not pending
Enum.name: PENDSVSET_0

Enum.description: write: changes PendSV exception state to pending; read: PendSV exception is pending
Enum.name: PENDSVSET_1

Enum.description: write: no effect; read: NMI exception is not pending
Enum.name: NMIPENDSET_0

Enum.description: write: changes NMI exception state to pending; read: NMI exception is pending
Enum.name: NMIPENDSET_1

Register.description: Application Interrupt and Reset Control Register
Register.name: SCB_AIRCR

BitField.description: Writing 1 to this bit causes a local system reset
BitField.name: VECTRESET

BitField.description: Writing 1 to this bit clears all active state information for fixed and configurable exceptions.
BitField.name: VECTCLRACTIVE

Enum.description: Clears all active state information for fixed and configurable exceptions
Enum.name: VECTCLRACTIVE_1

Enum.description: asserts a signal to the outer system that requests a reset
Enum.name: SYSRESETREQ_1

BitField.description: Interrupt priority grouping field. This field determines the split of group priority from subpriority.
BitField.name: PRIGROUP

BitField.description: Indicates sleep-on-exit when returning from Handler mode to Thread mode
BitField.name: SLEEPONEXIT

Enum.description: o not sleep when returning to Thread mode
Enum.name: SLEEPONEXIT_0

Enum.description: enter sleep, or deep sleep, on return from an ISR
Enum.name: SLEEPONEXIT_1

BitField.description: Controls whether the processor uses sleep or deep sleep as its low power mode
BitField.name: SLEEPDEEP

Enum.description: only enabled interrupts or events can wakeup the processor, disabled interrupts are excluded
Enum.name: SEVONPEND_0

Enum.description: enabled events and all interrupts, including disabled interrupts, can wakeup the processor
Enum.name: SEVONPEND_1

BitField.description: Indicates how the processor enters Thread mode
BitField.name: NONBASETHRDENA

Enum.description: processor can enter Thread mode only when no exception is active
Enum.name: NONBASETHRDENA_0

Enum.description: processor can enter Thread mode from any level under the control of an EXC_RETURN value
Enum.name: NONBASETHRDENA_1

BitField.description: Enables unprivileged software access to the STIR
BitField.name: USERSETMPEND

Enum.description: do not trap unaligned halfword and word accesses
Enum.name: UNALIGN_TRP_0

Enum.description: trap unaligned halfword and word accesses
Enum.name: UNALIGN_TRP_1

BitField.description: Enables faulting or halting when the processor executes an SDIV or UDIV instruction with a divisor of 0
BitField.name: DIV_0_TRP

BitField.description: Enables handlers with priority -1 or -2 to ignore data BusFaults caused by load and store instructions.
BitField.name: BFHFNMIGN

Enum.description: data bus faults caused by load and store instructions cause a lock-up
Enum.name: BFHFNMIGN_0

Enum.description: handlers running at priority -1 and -2 ignore data bus faults caused by load and store instructions
Enum.name: BFHFNMIGN_1

BitField.description: Indicates stack alignment on exception entry
BitField.name: STKALIGN

BitField.description: Always reads-as-one. It indicates branch prediction is enabled.
BitField.name: BP

BitField.description: Priority of system handler 15, SysTick exception
BitField.name: PRI_15

Register.description: System Handler Control and State Register
Register.name: SCB_SHCSR

Enum.description: the processor attempted an instruction fetch from a location that does not permit execution
Enum.name: IACCVIOL_1

Enum.description: the processor attempted a load or store at a location that does not permit the operation
Enum.name: DACCVIOL_1

BitField.description: MemManage fault on unstacking for a return from exception
BitField.name: MUNSTKERR

Enum.description: unstack for an exception return has caused one or more access violations
Enum.name: MUNSTKERR_1

BitField.description: MemManage fault on stacking for exception entry
BitField.name: MSTKERR

Enum.description: stacking for an exception entry has caused one or more access violations
Enum.name: MSTKERR_1

BitField.description: MemManage fault occurred during floating-point lazy state preservation
BitField.name: MLSPERR

Enum.description: No MemManage fault occurred during floating-point lazy state preservation
Enum.name: MLSPERR_0

Enum.description: A MemManage fault occurred during floating-point lazy state preservation
Enum.name: MLSPERR_1

BitField.description: MemManage Fault Address Register (MMFAR) valid flag
BitField.name: MMARVALID

Enum.description: value in MMAR is not a valid fault address
Enum.name: MMARVALID_0

Enum.description: MMAR holds a valid fault address
Enum.name: MMARVALID_1

Enum.description: a data bus error has occurred, and the PC value stacked for the exception return points to the instruction that caused the fault
Enum.name: PRECISERR_1

Enum.description: a data bus error has occurred, but the return address in the stack frame is not related to the instruction that caused the error
Enum.name: IMPRECISERR_1

BitField.description: BusFault on unstacking for a return from exception
BitField.name: UNSTKERR

Enum.description: unstack for an exception return has caused one or more BusFaults
Enum.name: UNSTKERR_1

BitField.description: BusFault on stacking for exception entry
BitField.name: STKERR

Enum.description: stacking for an exception entry has caused one or more BusFaults
Enum.name: STKERR_1

BitField.description: Bus fault occurred during floating-point lazy state preservation
BitField.name: LSPERR

Enum.description: No bus fault occurred during floating-point lazy state preservation
Enum.name: LSPERR_0

Enum.description: A bus fault occurred during floating-point lazy state preservation
Enum.name: LSPERR_1

Enum.description: value in BFAR is not a valid fault address
Enum.name: BFARVALID_0

Enum.description: BFAR holds a valid fault address
Enum.name: BFARVALID_1

Enum.description: the processor has attempted to execute an undefined instruction
Enum.name: UNDEFINSTR_1

Enum.description: the processor has attempted to execute an instruction that makes illegal use of the EPSR
Enum.name: INVSTATE_1

BitField.description: Invalid PC load UsageFault, caused by an invalid PC load by EXC_RETURN
BitField.name: INVPC

Enum.description: the processor has attempted an illegal load of EXC_RETURN to the PC
Enum.name: INVPC_1

Enum.description: no UsageFault caused by attempting to access a coprocessor
Enum.name: NOCP_0

Enum.description: the processor has attempted to access a coprocessor
Enum.name: NOCP_1

Enum.description: no unaligned access fault, or unaligned access trapping not enabled
Enum.name: UNALIGNED_0

Enum.description: the processor has made an unaligned memory access
Enum.name: UNALIGNED_1

Enum.description: no divide by zero fault, or divide by zero trapping not enabled
Enum.name: DIVBYZERO_0

Enum.description: the processor has executed an SDIV or UDIV instruction with a divisor of 0
Enum.name: DIVBYZERO_1

BitField.description: Indicates a BusFault on a vector table read during exception processing.
BitField.name: VECTTBL

Enum.description: no BusFault on vector table read
Enum.name: VECTTBL_0

BitField.description: Indicates a forced hard fault, generated by escalation of a fault with configurable priority that cannot be handles, either because of priority or because it is disabled.
BitField.name: FORCED

BitField.description: Reserved for Debug use. When writing to the register you must write 0 to this bit, otherwise behavior is Unpredictable.
BitField.name: DEBUGEVT

Enum.description: Debug event has occurred. The Debug Fault Status Register has been updated.
Enum.name: DEBUGEVT_1

BitField.description: Indicates a debug event generated by either a C_HALT or C_STEP request, triggered by a write to the DHCSR or a step request triggered by setting DEMCR.MON_STEP to 1.
BitField.name: HALTED

Enum.description: No active halt request debug event
Enum.name: HALTED_0

BitField.description: Debug event generated by BKPT instruction execution or a breakpoint match in FPB
BitField.name: BKPT

Enum.description: At least one current breakpoint debug event
Enum.name: BKPT_1

BitField.description: Debug event generated by the DWT
BitField.name: DWTTRAP

Enum.description: No current debug events generated by the DWT
Enum.name: DWTTRAP_0

Enum.description: At least one current debug event generated by the DWT
Enum.name: DWTTRAP_1

BitField.description: Indicates triggering of a Vector catch
BitField.name: VCATCH

BitField.description: Debug event generated because of the assertion of an external debug request
BitField.name: EXTERNAL

Enum.description: No external debug request debug event
Enum.name: EXTERNAL_0

Enum.description: Support for Thumb encoding including Thumb-2 technology, with all basic 16-bit and 32-bit instructions.
Enum.name: STATE0_3

Enum.description: The processor does not support the ARM instruction set.
Enum.name: STATE1_0

BitField.description: Support for memory-mapped debug model for M profile processors
BitField.name: DEBUGMODEL

Enum.description: Support for M profile Debug architecture, with memory-mapped access.
Enum.name: DEBUGMODEL_1

BitField.description: Gives information about the IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED features of a processor implementation.
BitField.name: IMPLEMENTATION_DEFINED0

BitField.description: Gives information about the IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED features of a processor implementation.

BitField.description: Gives information about the IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED features of a processor implementation.
BitField.name: IMPLEMENTATION_DEFINED2

BitField.description: Gives information about the IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED features of a processor implementation.
BitField.name: IMPLEMENTATION_DEFINED3

Enum.description: PMSAv7, providing support for a base region and subregions.

BitField.description: Indicates the outermost shareability domain implemented
BitField.name: OUTERMOST_SHAREABILITY

BitField.description: Gives information about the implemented memory model and memory management support.

BitField.description: Indicates the support for Wait For Interrupt (WFI) stalling

BitField.description: Gives information about the implemented memory model and memory management support.

BitField.description: Indicates the supported Bit Counting instructions
BitField.name: BITCOUNT_INSTRS

Enum.description: Adds support for the CLZ instruction
Enum.name: BITCOUNT_INSTRS_1

Enum.description: Adds support for the BFC, BFI, SBFX, and UBFX instructions
Enum.name: BITFIELD_INSTRS_1

BitField.description: Indicates the supported combined Compare and Branch instructions
BitField.name: CMPBRANCH_INSTRS

Enum.description: Adds support for the CBNZ and CBZ instructions
Enum.name: CMPBRANCH_INSTRS_1

Enum.description: None supported, except for separately attributed architectures, for example the Floating-point extension
Enum.name: COPROC_INSTRS_0

Enum.description: Adds support for generic CDP, LDC, MCR, MRC, and STC instructions
Enum.name: COPROC_INSTRS_1

Enum.description: As for 1, and adds support for generic CDP2, LDC2, MCR2, MRC2, and STC2 instructions
Enum.name: COPROC_INSTRS_2

Enum.description: As for 2, and adds support for generic MCRR and MRRC instructions
Enum.name: COPROC_INSTRS_3

Enum.description: As for 3, and adds support for generic MCRR2 and MRRC2 instructions
Enum.name: COPROC_INSTRS_4

Enum.description: Adds support for the BKPT instruction
Enum.name: DEBUG_INSTRS_1

Enum.description: Adds support for the SDIV and UDIV instructions
Enum.name: DIVIDE_INSTRS_1

Enum.description: Adds support for the SXTB, SXTH, UXTB, and UXTH instructions
Enum.name: EXTEND_INSTRS_1

Enum.description: As for 1, and adds support for the SXTAB, SXTAB16, SXTAH, SXTB16, UXTAB, UXTAB16, UXTAH, and UXTB16 instructions
Enum.name: EXTEND_INSTRS_2

Enum.description: Adds support for the IT instructions, and for the IT bits in the PSRs
Enum.name: IFTHEN_INSTRS_1

BitField.description: Indicates the support for data-processing instructions with long immediate
BitField.name: IMMEDIATE_INSTRS

Enum.description: Adds support for the ADDW, MOVW, MOVT, and SUBW instructions
Enum.name: IMMEDIATE_INSTRS_1

Enum.description: Adds support for the BX instruction, and the T bit in the PSR
Enum.name: INTERWORK_INSTRS_1

Enum.description: As for 1, and adds support for the BLX instruction, and PC loads have BX-like behavior
Enum.name: INTERWORK_INSTRS_2

BitField.description: Indicates the supported additional load and store instructions
BitField.name: LOADSTORE_INSTRS

Enum.description: Adds support for the LDRD and STRD instructions
Enum.name: LOADSTORE_INSTRS_1

BitField.description: Indicates the supported Memory Hint instructions
BitField.name: MEMHINT_INSTRS

Enum.description: Adds support for the PLD instruction, ARMv7-M unused.
Enum.name: MEMHINT_INSTRS_1

Enum.description: As for 1 or 2, and adds support for the PLI instruction.
Enum.name: MEMHINT_INSTRS_3

BitField.description: Indicates the support for multi-access interruptible instructions
BitField.name: MULTIACCESSINT_INSTRS

Enum.description: None supported. This means the LDM and STM instructions are not interruptible. ARMv7-M unused.
Enum.name: MULTIACCESSINT_INSTRS_0

Enum.description: LDM and STM instructions are restartable.
Enum.name: MULTIACCESSINT_INSTRS_1

Enum.description: LDM and STM instructions are continuable.
Enum.name: MULTIACCESSINT_INSTRS_2

BitField.description: Indicates the supported additional Multiply instructions
BitField.name: MULT_INSTRS

Enum.description: None supported. This means only MUL is supported. ARMv7-M unused.
Enum.name: MULT_INSTRS_0

Enum.description: Adds support for the MLA instruction, ARMv7-M unused.
Enum.name: MULT_INSTRS_1

Enum.description: As for 1, and adds support for the MLS instruction.
Enum.name: MULT_INSTRS_2

BitField.description: Indicates the supported advanced signed Multiply instructions
BitField.name: MULTS_INSTRS

Enum.description: Adds support for the SMULL and SMLAL instructions
Enum.name: MULTS_INSTRS_1

Enum.description: As for 1, and adds support for the SMLABB, SMLABT, SMLALBB, SMLALBT, SMLALTB, SMLALTT, SMLATB, SMLATT, SMLAWB, SMLAWT, SMULBB, SMULBT, SMULTB, SMULTT, SMULWB, and SMULWT instructions.
Enum.name: MULTS_INSTRS_2

Enum.description: As for 2, and adds support for the SMLAD, SMLADX, SMLALD, SMLALDX, SMLSD, SMLSDX, SMLSLD, SMLSLDX, SMMLA, SMMLAR, SMMLS, SMMLSR, SMMUL, SMMULR, SMUAD, SMUADX, SMUSD, and SMUSDX instructions.
Enum.name: MULTS_INSTRS_3

BitField.description: Indicates the supported advanced unsigned Multiply instructions
BitField.name: MULTU_INSTRS

Enum.description: Adds support for the UMULL and UMLAL instructions.
Enum.name: MULTU_INSTRS_1

Enum.description: As for 1, and adds support for the UMAAL instruction.
Enum.name: MULTU_INSTRS_2

Enum.description: Adds support for the REV, REV16, and REVSH instructions, ARMv7-M unused.
Enum.name: REVERSAL_INSTRS_1

Enum.description: As for 1, and adds support for the RBIT instruction.
Enum.name: REVERSAL_INSTRS_2

Enum.description: Adds support for the QADD, QDADD, QDSUB, and QSUB instructions, and for the Q bit in the PSRs.
Enum.name: SATURATE_INSTRS_1

Enum.description: Adds support for the SSAT and USAT instructions, and for the Q bit in the PSRs.
Enum.name: SIMD_INSTRS_1

Enum.description: As for 1, and adds support for the PKHBT, PKHTB, QADD16, QADD8, QASX, QSUB16, QSUB8, QSAX, SADD16, SADD8, SASX, SEL, SHADD16, SHADD8, SHASX, SHSUB16, SHSUB8, SHSAX, SSAT16, SSUB16, SSUB8, SSAX, SXTAB16, SXTB16, UADD16, UADD8, UASX, UHADD16, UHADD8, UHASX, UHSUB16, UHSUB8, UHSAX, UQADD16, UQADD8, UQASX, UQSUB16, UQSUB8, UQSAX, USAD8, USADA8, USAT16, USUB16, USUB8, USAX, UXTAB16, and UXTB16 instructions. Also adds support for the GE[3:0] bits in the PSRs.
Enum.name: SIMD_INSTRS_3

Enum.description: Adds support for the SVC instruction.
Enum.name: SVC_INSTRS_1

BitField.description: Together with the ID_ISAR4[SYNCHPRIM_INSTRS_FRAC] indicates the supported Synchronization Primitives
BitField.name: SYNCHPRIM_INSTRS

BitField.description: Indicates the supported Table Branch instructions
BitField.name: TABBRANCH_INSTRS

Enum.description: Adds support for the TBB and TBH instructions.
Enum.name: TABBRANCH_INSTRS_1

BitField.description: Indicates the supported non flag-setting MOV instructions
BitField.name: THUMBCOPY_INSTRS

Enum.description: Adds support for encoding T1 of the MOV (register) instruction copying from a low register to a low register.
Enum.name: THUMBCOPY_INSTRS_1

BitField.description: Indicates the supported non flag-setting MOV instructions
BitField.name: TRUENOP_INSTRS

Enum.description: Adds support for encoding T1 of the MOV (register) instruction copying from a low register to a low register.
Enum.name: TRUENOP_INSTRS_1

BitField.description: Indicates the supported unprivileged instructions. These are the instruction variants indicated by a T suffix.
BitField.name: UNPRIV_INSTRS

Enum.description: Adds support for the LDRBT, LDRT, STRBT, and STRT instructions.
Enum.name: UNPRIV_INSTRS_1

Enum.description: As for 1, and adds support for the LDRHT, LDRSBT, LDRSHT, and STRHT instructions.
Enum.name: UNPRIV_INSTRS_2

BitField.description: Indicates the support for instructions with shifts
BitField.name: WITHSHIFTS_INSTRS

Enum.description: Nonzero shifts supported only in MOV and shift instructions.
Enum.name: WITHSHIFTS_INSTRS_0

Enum.description: Adds support for shifts of loads and stores over the range LSL 0-3.
Enum.name: WITHSHIFTS_INSTRS_1

Enum.description: As for 1, and adds support for other constant shift options, on loads, stores, and other instructions.
Enum.name: WITHSHIFTS_INSTRS_3

BitField.description: Indicates the support for Writeback addressing modes
BitField.name: WRITEBACK_INSTRS

Enum.description: Basic support. Only the LDM, STM, PUSH, and POP instructions support writeback addressing modes. ARMv7-M unused.
Enum.name: WRITEBACK_INSTRS_0

Enum.description: Adds support for all of the writeback addressing modes defined in the ARMv7-M architecture.
Enum.name: WRITEBACK_INSTRS_1

Enum.description: Adds support for the DMB, DSB, and ISB barrier instructions.
Enum.name: BARRIER_INSTRS_1

BitField.description: Together with the ID_ISAR3[SYNCHPRIM_INSTRS] indicates the supported Synchronization Primitives
BitField.name: SYNCHPRIM_INSTRS_FRAC

BitField.description: Indicates the supported M profile instructions to modify the PSRs
BitField.name: PSR_M_INSTRS

Enum.description: Adds support for the M-profile forms of the CPS, MRS, and MSR instructions, to access the PSRs.
Enum.name: PSR_M_INSTRS_1

BitField.description: Indicate the type of cache implemented at level 1.
BitField.name: CL1

BitField.description: Indicate the type of cache implemented at level 2.
BitField.name: CL2

BitField.description: Indicate the type of cache implemented at level 3.
BitField.name: CL3

BitField.description: Indicate the type of cache implemented at level 4.
BitField.name: CL4

BitField.description: Indicate the type of cache implemented at level 5.
BitField.name: CL5

BitField.description: Indicate the type of cache implemented at level 6.
BitField.name: CL6

BitField.description: Indicate the type of cache implemented at level 7.
BitField.name: CL7

BitField.description: Level of Unification Inner Shareable for the cache hierarchy. This field is RAZ.
BitField.name: LOUIS

BitField.description: Level of Coherency for the cache hierarchy
BitField.name: LOC

BitField.description: Level of Unification for the cache hierarchy
BitField.name: LOU

BitField.description: Log2 of the number of words in the smallest cache line of all the instruction caches that are controlled by the processor.
BitField.name: IMINLINE

BitField.description: Log2 of the number of words in the smallest cache line of all the data caches and unified caches that are controlled by the processor.
BitField.name: DMINLINE

BitField.description: Exclusives Reservation Granule. The maximum size of the reservation granule that has been implemented for the Load-Exclusive and Store-Exclusive instructions, encoded as Log2 of the number of words.
BitField.name: ERG

BitField.description: Cache Write-back Granule. The maximum size of memory that can be overwritten as a result of the eviction of a cache entry that has had a memory location in it modified, encoded as Log2 of the number of words.
BitField.name: CWG

BitField.description: (Associativity of cache) - 1, therefore a value of 0 indicates an associativity of 1. The associativity does not have to be a power of 2.
BitField.name: ASSOCIATIVITY

BitField.description: (Number of sets in cache) - 1, therefore a value of 0 indicates 1 set in the cache. The number of sets does not have to be a power of 2.
BitField.name: NUMSETS

BitField.description: Indicates whether the cache level supports write-allocation
BitField.name: WA

BitField.description: Indicates whether the cache level supports read-allocation
BitField.name: RA

BitField.description: Indicates whether the cache level supports write-back
BitField.name: WB

BitField.description: Indicates whether the cache level supports write-through
BitField.name: WT

BitField.description: TCM enable. When a TCM is disabled all accesses are made to the AXIM interface.
BitField.name: EN

BitField.description: Read-Modify-Write (RMW) enable. Indicates that all writes to TCM, that are not the full width of the TCM RAM, use a RMW sequence.
BitField.name: RMW

BitField.description: Retry phase enable. When enabled the processor guarantees to honor the retry output on the corresponding TCM interface, re-executing the instruction which carried out the TCM access.
BitField.name: RETEN

BitField.description: TCM size. Indicates the size of the relevant TCM.
BitField.name: SZ

BitField.description: TCM enable. When a TCM is disabled all accesses are made to the AXIM interface.
BitField.name: EN

BitField.description: Read-Modify-Write (RMW) enable. Indicates that all writes to TCM, that are not the full width of the TCM RAM, use a RMW sequence.
BitField.name: RMW

BitField.description: Retry phase enable. When enabled the processor guarantees to honor the retry output on the corresponding TCM interface, re-executing the instruction which carried out the TCM access.
BitField.name: RETEN

BitField.description: TCM size. Indicates the size of the relevant TCM.
BitField.name: SZ

Enum.description: AHBP disabled. When disabled all accesses are made to the AXIM interface.
Enum.name: EN_0

BitField.description: Shared cacheable-is-WT for data cache. Enables limited cache coherency usage.
BitField.name: SIWT

Enum.description: Normal Cacheable Shared locations are treated as being Non-cacheable. Default mode of operation for Shared memory.
Enum.name: SIWT_0

Enum.description: Normal Cacheable shared locations are treated as Write-Through.
Enum.name: SIWT_1

BitField.description: Enables ECC in the instruction and data cache.
BitField.name: ECCDIS

Enum.description: Enables ECC in the instruction and data cache.
Enum.name: ECCDIS_0

Enum.description: Disables ECC in the instruction and data cache.
Enum.name: ECCDIS_1

BitField.description: Enables Force Write-Through in the data cache.
BitField.name: FORCEWT

Enum.description: Enables Force Write-Through. All Cacheable memory regions are treated as Write-Through.
Enum.name: FORCEWT_1

Enum.description: AHBS access priority demoted. This is the reset value.
Enum.name: CTL_0

Enum.description: AHBS access priority demoted by initializing the fairness counter to the CM7_AHBSCR[INITCOUNT] value when the software execution priority is higher than or equal to the threshold level programed in CM7_AHBSCR[TPRI].
Enum.name: CTL_2

Enum.description: AHBSPRI signal has control of access priority.
Enum.name: CTL_3

BitField.description: Threshold execution priority for AHBS traffic demotion.
BitField.name: TPRI

BitField.description: Indicates the type of fault on the AXIM interface. Only valid when AXIM is 1.
BitField.name: AXIMTYPE

BitField.description: Value to load into the SYST_CVR when the counter is enabled and when it reaches 0
BitField.name: RELOAD

BitField.description: The current value of the SysTick counter
BitField.name: CURRENT

BitField.description: Indicates whether the device provides a reference clock to the processor
BitField.name: NOREF

BitField.description: Indicates whether the TENMS value is exact
BitField.name: SKEW

BitField.description: Reload value for 10ms (100Hz) timing, subject to system clock skew errors
BitField.name: TENMS

BitField.description: The total number of interrupt lines supported by an implementation, defined in groups of 32.
BitField.name: INTLINESNUM

BitField.description: Disables dynamic allocation of ADD and SUB instructions
BitField.name: DISDYNADD

BitField.description: Indicates instruction type might not be issued in channel 1
BitField.name: DISISSCH1

BitField.description: Indicates nothing can be dual-issued when this instruction type is in channel 0
BitField.name: DISDI

BitField.description: Indicates no new entries are allocated in BTAC, but existing entries can be updated
BitField.name: DISBTACALLOC

BitField.description: Indicates BTAC is not used and only static branch prediction can occur
BitField.name: DISBTACREAD

BitField.description: Disables ITM and DWT ATB flush
BitField.name: DISITMATBFLUSH

BitField.description: Disables dynamic read allocate mode for Write-Back Write-Allocate memory regions
BitField.name: DISRAMODE

BitField.description: Indicates the exception number of the highest priority pending enabled exception
BitField.name: VECTPENDING

BitField.description: Indicates whether there are preempted active exceptions
BitField.name: RETTOBASE

Register.description: Application Interrupt and Reset Control Register
Register.name: AIRCR

BitField.description: Controls whether the processor uses sleep or deep sleep as its low power mode
BitField.name: SLEEPDEEP

BitField.description: Indicates sleep-on-exit when returning from Handler mode to Thread mode
BitField.name: SLEEPONEXIT

BitField.description: Indicates stack alignment on exception entry
BitField.name: STKALIGN

BitField.description: Enables handlers with priority -1 or-2 to ignore data BusFaults caused by load and store instructions
BitField.name: BFHFNMIGN

BitField.description: Enables faulting or halting when the processor executes an SDIVor UDIV instruction with a divisor of 0
BitField.name: DIV_0_TRP

BitField.description: Enables unprivileged software access to the STIR
BitField.name: USERSETMPEND

BitField.description: Indicates how the processor enters Thread mode
BitField.name: NONBASETHRDENA

Register.description: System Handler Control and State Register
Register.name: SHCSR

BitField.description: MemManage Fault Address Register(MMFAR) valid flag
BitField.name: MMARVALID

BitField.description: Indicates a MemManage fault occurred during floating-point lazy state preservation
BitField.name: MLSPERR

BitField.description: MemManage fault on stacking for exception entry
BitField.name: MSTKERR

BitField.description: MemManage fault on unstacking for a return from exception
BitField.name: MUNSTKERR

BitField.description: Indicates a bus fault occurred during floating-point lazy state preservation
BitField.name: LSPERR

BitField.description: BusFault on stacking for exception entry
BitField.name: STKERR

BitField.description: BusFault on unstacking for a return from exception
BitField.name: UNSTKERR

BitField.description: Invalid PC load UsageFault, causedby an invalid PC load by EXC_RETURN
BitField.name: INVPC

BitField.description: Indicates a forced hard fault, generated by escalation of a fault with configurable priority that cannot be handled, either because of priority or because it is disabled
BitField.name: FORCED

BitField.description: Indicates a BusFault on a vectortable read during exception processing
BitField.name: VECTTBL

BitField.description: When the MMARVALID bit of the MMFSR is set to 1, this field holds the address of the location that generated the MemManage fault
BitField.name: ADDRESS

BitField.description: When the BFARVALID bit of the BFSR is set to1, this field holds the address of the location that generated the BusFault
BitField.name: ADDRESS

BitField.description: Implementation defined, the bits map to the AUXFAULT input signals
BitField.name: IMPDEF

BitField.description: Level of Unification Inner Shareable for the cache hierarchy
BitField.name: LoUIS

BitField.description: Level of Coherency for the cache hierarchy
BitField.name: LoC

BitField.description: Level of Unification Uniprocessor for the cache hierarchy
BitField.name: LoC

BitField.description: Log2 Number of words in cache line - 2
BitField.name: LineSize

BitField.description: Selects either instruction or data cache
BitField.name: InD

BitField.description: Identifies which cache level to select
BitField.name: Level

BitField.description: Enables Force Write-Through in the data cache
BitField.name: FORCEWT

BitField.description: Enables ECC in the instruction and data cache
BitField.name: ECCDIS

BitField.description: Threshold execution priority for AHBS traffic demotion
BitField.name: TPRI

BitField.description: Indicates the type of fault on the AXIM
BitField.name: AXIMTYPE

BitField.description: The location of the unpopulated floating-point register space allocated on an exception stack frame
BitField.name: ADDRESSS

BitField.description: Number of supported MPU instruction regions
BitField.name: IREGION

BitField.description: Number of supported MPU data regions
BitField.name: DREGION

BitField.description: Support for unified or separate instruction and date memory maps
BitField.name: SEPARATE

BitField.description: Enables privileged software access to the default memory map
BitField.name: PRIVDEFENA

BitField.description: Enable the operation of MPU during hard fault, NMI, and FAULTMASK handlers
BitField.name: HFNMIENA

BitField.description: Indicates the MPU region referenced by the MPU_RBAR and MPU_RASR registers
BitField.name: REGION

Register.description: MPU Region Attribute and Size Register
Register.name: MPU_RASR
